Sentences_to: Blessed are those who keep justice. Blessed is one who does what is right at all times.
Translated_sentences: Blessed are those who guard the judgment and do justice for all time.

Sentences_from: Z Hemana: Synowie Hemanowi: Bukkijasz, Matanijasz, Husyjel, Zebuel, i Jerymot, Chananijasz, Chanani, Eliata, Gieddalty, i Romantyjeser, i Jasbekassa, Malloty, Hotyr, Machazyjot.
Sentences_to: Of Heman; the sons of Heman: Bukkiah, Mattaniah, Uzziel, Shebuel, and Jerimoth, Hananiah, Hanani, Eliathah, Giddalti, and Romamti-Ezer, Joshbekashah, Mallothi, Hothir, Mahazioth.
Translated_sentences: From Heman: Sons of Heman: Bukkiyah, Mathaniyah, Hussiyel, Zebuel, and Jerymot, Cananiah, Chanani, Eliata, Gieddalty, and Romantyjeser, and Jasbekassa, Mallota, Hotyr, Machazyjot.

Sentences_from: I oderwałem królestwo od domu Dawidowego, a dałem je tobie, tyś jednak nie był jako sługa mój Dawid, który strzegł rozkazania mego, i który chodził za mną całem sercem swojem, to tylko czyniąc, co jest dobrego w oczach moich;
Sentences_to: and tore the kingdom away from the house of David, and gave it you; and yet you have not been as my servant David, who kept my commandments, and who followed me with all his heart, to do that only which was right in my eyes,
Translated_sentences: And I tore the kingdom from the house of David, and I gave it to you, but you were not as my servant David, who guarded my commandment, and who followed me with all his heart, only doing what is good in my sight;

Sentences_from: Arod, od którego dom Arodytów; Aryjel, od którego dom Aryjelitów.
Sentences_to: of Arod, the family of the Arodites; of Areli, the family of the Arelites.
Translated_sentences: Arod, from which the house of the Arodites; Aryjel, from whom the house of the Aryelites.

Sentences_from: Jako cieó, który ustępuje, uchodzić muszę; zganiają mię jako szaraóczę.
Sentences_to: I fade away like an evening shadow. I am shaken off like a locust.
Translated_sentences: As a heavy that gives way, I have to get away; they rebuke me as a grey.

Sentences_from: I stało się, jakoby po trzech miesiącach, powiedziano Judzie, mówiąc: Dopuściła się nierządu Tamar, synowa twoja, a oto, już brzemienna jest z nierządu. Tedy rzekł Judas: Wywiedźcie ją, aby była spalona.
Sentences_to: It happened about three months later, that it was told Judah, saying, "Tamar, your daughter-in-law, has played the prostitute; and moreover, behold, she is with child by prostitution." Judah said, "Bring her out, and let her be burnt."
Translated_sentences: And it became as if after three months, Juda was told, saying, Tamar, your daughter-in-law, has committed fornication, and behold, she is already pregnant with fornication. Then Judas said, Bring her out, that she may be burned.

Sentences_from: Postanowiłem przymierze z wybranym moim: przysiągłem Dawidowi, słudze swemu,
Sentences_to: 'I will establish your seed forever, and build up your throne to all generations.'" Selah.
Translated_sentences: I made a covenant with my chosen one: I swed in David, my servant,

Sentences_from: Lecz on nie chciał usłuchać głosu jej, ale zmógłszy ją, uczynił jej gwałt, i leżał z nią.
Sentences_to: However he would not listen to her voice; but being stronger than she, he forced her, and lay with her.
Translated_sentences: But he refused to listen to her voice, but ever made her guilty, he raped her, and lay with her.

Sentences_from: Niechże będą zawstydzeni wszyscy, którzy służą obrazom, którzy się chlubią w bałwanach; kłaniajcież mu się wszyscy bogowie.
Sentences_to: Let all them be shamed who serve engraved images, who boast in their idols. Worship him, all you gods!
Translated_sentences: Let all who serve images, who boast in idols, be ashamed; bow down to him, all the gods.

Sentences_from: Aby sądził lud twój w sprawiedliwości, a ubogich twoich w prawości.
Sentences_to: He will judge your people with righteousness, and your poor with justice.
Translated_sentences: That thy people may judge in righteousness and thy poor in righteousness.

Sentences_from: Leniwego żądość zabija; bo ręce jego robić nie chcą.
Sentences_to: The desire of the sluggard kills him, for his hands refuse to labor.
Translated_sentences: Lazy lust kills; because his hands do not want to do.

Sentences_from: Któż uwierzył kazaniu naszemu, a ramię Pańskie komu objawione jest?
Sentences_to: Who has believed our message? To whom has the arm of Yahweh been revealed?
Translated_sentences: Who has believed our sermon, and the arm of the Lord to whom is revealed?

Sentences_from: Pieśó wyuczająca podana Asafowi. Słuchaj, ludu mój! zakonu mego; nakłoócież uszów swych do słów ust moich.
Sentences_to: < < A contemplation by Asaph. > > Hear my teaching, my people. Turn your ears to the words of my mouth.
Translated_sentences: A training song given to Asaf. Listen, my people! of my law; put your ears to the words of my mouth.

Sentences_from: A ściągnąwszy Dawid rękę swą do torby, wyjął z niej kamień, i cisnął z procy, a ugodził Filistyóczyka w czoło jego, tak iż utknął kamień w czole jego, i padł twarzą swą na ziemię.
Sentences_to: David put his hand in his bag, took a stone, and slung it, and struck the Philistine in his forehead; and the stone sank into his forehead, and he fell on his face to the earth.
Translated_sentences: And David, having pulled his hand into his bag, he took out a stone from it, and threw it from the slingshot, and struck the Philistine in his forehead, so that a stone was stuck in his forehead, and fell face down on the ground.

Sentences_from: A oni nie wiedzieli, żeby rozumiał Józef; bo tłumacz był między nimi.
Sentences_to: They didn't know that Joseph understood them; for there was an interpreter between them.
Translated_sentences: And they did not know that Joseph understood; because the interpreter was between them.

Sentences_from: Synowie tedy Izraelscy przywiodą ofiary swoje, które zabijali na polu; przywiodą je Panu do drzwi namiotu zgromadzenia, do kapłana; a tak niechaj sprawują ofiary spokojne Panu.
Sentences_to: He shall take from the congregation of the children of Israel two male goats for a sin offering, and one ram for a burnt offering.
Translated_sentences: The sons of Israel, the then, will bring their victims, whom they have killed in the field; they will bring them to the Lord to the door of the tent of the congregation, to the priest; and so let them make sacrifices that are calm to the Lord.

Sentences_from: A jeźli jest biała głowa szacunek twój będzie trzydzieści syklów,
Sentences_to: If it is a female, then your valuation shall be thirty shekels.
Translated_sentences: And if there is a white head, your respect will be thirty shekels,

Sentences_from: I lekceż sobie ważysz pociechy Boskie? i maszże jeszcze co tak skrytego w sobie?
Sentences_to: Are the consolations of God too small for you, even the word that is gentle toward you?
Translated_sentences: And do you weigh the consolations of God lightly? and you still have something so hidden in yourself?

Sentences_from: Tedy będę mówił, a nie będę się go bał; bom ja nie jest taki sam u siebie.
Sentences_to: then I would speak, and not fear him, for I am not so in myself.
Translated_sentences: Then I will speak, and I will not be afraid of him; bom I'm not the same at home.

Sentences_from: Była też jeszcze wojna z Filistynami, gdzie zabił Elchana, syn Jairowy, Lachmiego, brata Golijata Gietejczyka, którego drzewce u włóczni było nawój tkacki.
Sentences_to: There was again war with the Philistines; and Elhanan the son of Jair killed Lahmi the brother of Goliath the Gittite, the staff of whose spear was like a weaver's beam.
Translated_sentences: There was also a war with the Philistines, where he killed Elchan, the son of Jairus, Lachmi, the brother of Goliyat Gietejczyk, whose pole at the spear was a weaving reel.

Sentences_from: Zaprawdę pomija człowiek jako cieó; zaprawdę próżno się kłopocze, zgromadza, a nie wie, kto to pobierze.
Sentences_to: Now, Lord, what do I wait for? My hope is in you.
Translated_sentences: Indeed, man omits man as a cieó; indeed, it is in vain to trouble, to gather, and not to know who will take it.

Sentences_from: I rzekł: Cóż to za miasta, któreś mi dał, bracie mój? I nazwał je ziemią Chabul, aż do dnia tego.
Sentences_to: He said, "What cities are these which you have given me, my brother?" He called them the land of Cabul to this day.
Translated_sentences: And he said, What are these cities which you have given me, my brother? And he called them the land of Chabul, until that day.

Sentences_from: Czego gdy się Danijel dowiedział, że był podany na piśmie, wszedł do domu swego, gdzie otworzone były okna w pokoju jego przeciw Jeruzalemowi, a trzy kroć przez dzień klękał na kolana swoje, i modlił się, a chwałę dawał Bogu swemu, jako to był z wykł przedtem czynić.
Sentences_to: Then these men assembled together, and found Daniel making petition and supplication before his God.
Translated_sentences: What Danijel learned that he had been given in writing, he went into his house, where the windows in his room against Jerusalem were opened, and three cuts a day he knelt on his knees and prayed, and gave glory to his God, as he had done before.

Sentences_from: Którzy myślą, jakoby z pamięci wywieść ludowi mojemu imię moje snami swemi, które powiadają każdy bliźniemu swemu, jako zapomnieli ojcowie ich na imię moje dla Baala.
Sentences_to: who think to cause my people to forget my name by their dreams which they tell every man to his neighbor, as their fathers forgot my name for Baal.
Translated_sentences: Who think that they have ever eduished from memory my people my name with their dreams, which every one says to his neighbor, as their fathers have forgotten their name for Baal.

Sentences_from: Bo wykupił Pan Jakóba; przeto wybawi go z ręki tego, który jest mocniejszy nadeó.
Sentences_to: For Yahweh has ransomed Jacob, and redeemed him from the hand of him who was stronger than he.
Translated_sentences: For the Lord bought Jacob; therefore he will deliver him from the hand of him who is stronger nadeó.

Sentences_from: I posłał Elijakima, sprawcę domu swego, i Sobnę pisarza, i starszych z kapłanów obleczonych w wory, do Izajasza proroka, syna Amosowego.
Sentences_to: He sent Eliakim, who was over the household, and Shebna the scribe, and the elders of the priests, covered with sackcloth, to Isaiah the prophet, the son of Amoz.
Translated_sentences: And he sent Elijakim, the author of his house, and the Writer's Council, and the elders of the priests clothed in sacks, to Isaiah the prophet, the son of Amos.

Sentences_from: Tedy rzekł król do niewiasty: Idź do domu twego, a ja skażę za tobą.
Sentences_to: The king said to the woman, "Go to your house, and I will give a command concerning you."
Translated_sentences: Then the king said to the woman, Go to your house, and I will scudge you.

Sentences_from: Ciągnijmy przeciwko ziemi Judzkiej, a utrapmy ją leżą, i oderwijmy ją do siebie, a postanówmy króla w pośród niej, syna Tabealowego.
Sentences_to: "Let's go up against Judah, and tear it apart, and let's divide it among ourselves, and set up a king in its midst, even the son of Tabeel."
Translated_sentences: Let us pull against the land of Judah, and let us afflict it, and let us tear it away to ourselves, and let us stand the king in the midst of it, the son of Tabeal.

Sentences_from: I ujrzał wozy, i dwa rzędy jezdnych; wozy, które osły, i wozy, które wielbłądy ciągnęły: i przypatrywał się im z wielką bardzo pilnością.
Sentences_to: When he sees a troop, horsemen in pairs, a troop of donkeys, a troop of camels, he shall listen diligently with great attentiveness."
Translated_sentences: And he saw wagons, and two rows of carts; the carts that the don don donbs pulled, and the carts that the camels pulled: and he watched them with great diligence.

Sentences_from: A tak posłał ten, który był sprawcą domu, i ten, który był sprawcą miasta, i starsi, i ci, którzy wychowywali syny królewskie, do Jehu, mówiąc: Słudzyśmy twoi, a co nam rozkażesz, uczynimy. Nie postanowiemy króla żadnego; co dobrego jest w oczach twoich, czyń.
Sentences_to: He who was over the household, and he who was over the city, the elders also, and those who raised the children, sent to Jehu, saying, "We are your servants, and will do all that you ask us. We will not make any man king. You do that which is good in your eyes."
Translated_sentences: And so sent the one who was the author of the house, and the one who was the author of the city, and the elders, and those who raised the king's sons, to Jehu, saying, We serve yours, and what you will order us, we will do. We will not decide any king; what good is in your eyes, do.

Sentences_from: I była gałka pod dwiema prętami jego, także gałka pod drugiemi dwiema prętami jego, i zaś gałka pod innemi dwiema prętami jego; tak było pod sześcią prętów wychodzących z niego.
Sentences_to: and a bud under two branches of one piece with it, and a bud under two branches of one piece with it, and a bud under two branches of one piece with it, for the six branches going out of it.
Translated_sentences: And there was a knob under two of his rods, also a knob under the other two rods of his, and a knob under the other two rods of his; so it was under the six rods coming out of it.

Sentences_from: Synowie też Merarego: Maheli, i Muzy. Teć są domy Lewiego według rodzajów ich.
Sentences_to: The sons of Merari: Mahli and Mushi. These are the families of the Levites according to their generations.
Translated_sentences: The sons of Merary: Maheli, and the Muse. Teć are the houses of Levi according to their kinds.

Sentences_from: Tedy zapalczywość Boża przypadła na nich, i pobił tłustych ich, a przedniejszych z Izraela poraził.
Sentences_to: when the anger of God went up against them, killed some of their fattest, and struck down the young men of Israel.
Translated_sentences: Then God's fierceness fell upon them, and he beat the fat ones, and the more of Israel struck them.

Sentences_from: Większa część ludzi przechwala się uczynnością swoją; ale w samej rzeczy, któż takiego znajdzie?
Sentences_to: Many men claim to be men of unfailing love, but who can find a faithful man?
Translated_sentences: The greater part of the people boast of their helpfulness; but in fact, who will find one?

Sentences_from: Drogę kłamliwą oddal odemnie, a zakonem twoim udaruj mię.
Sentences_to: Keep me from the way of deceit. Grant me your law graciously!
Translated_sentences: Take the deceitful way away from me, and by your law forgive me.

Sentences_from: A w onych czterech były kuchnie w około, także ogniska poczynione w onych kuchniach w około.
Sentences_to: There was a wall around in them, around the four, and boiling places were made under the walls all around.
Translated_sentences: And in these four there were kitchens in the area, also bonfires made in those kitchens in the surroundings.

Sentences_from: I czynili Izraelscy synowie złe przed oczyma Pańskiemi: zapomniawszy Pana, Boga swego, służyli Baalom, i święconym gajom.
Sentences_to: The children of Israel did that which was evil in the sight of Yahweh, and forgot Yahweh their God, and served the Baals and the Asheroth.
Translated_sentences: And the sons of Israel did evil before the eyes of the Lord: having forgotten the Lord their God, they served the Baals and the holy groves.

Sentences_from: Tedy szedł Ezaw do Ismaela, i pojął mimo inne żony swoje, Mahalatę córkę Ismaela, syna Abrahamowego, siostrę Nebajotowę, sobie za żonę.
Sentences_to: Esau went to Ishmael, and took, besides the wives that he had, Mahalath the daughter of Ishmael, Abraham's son, the sister of Nebaioth, to be his wife.
Translated_sentences: Then Esau went to Ishmael, and he took his other wives, Mahalata, daughter of Ishmael, son of Abraham, sister of Nebayote, as his wife.

Sentences_from: A oto, Saul szedł za wołami z pola, i rzekł Saul: Cóż się stało ludowi, iż płacze? I powiedzieli mu wszystkie słowa mężów z Jabes.
Sentences_to: Behold, Saul came following the oxen out of the field; and Saul said, "What ails the people that they weep?" They told him the words of the men of Jabesh.
Translated_sentences: And behold, Saul followed the oxen from the field, and Saul said, What has happened to the people that they weep? And they told him all the words of the men of Jabes.

Sentences_from: Także też uczyni siódmego dnia tegoż miesiąca za każdego, który z omyłki i z prostoty zgrzeszył; tak oczyścicie dom.
Sentences_to: So you shall do on the seventh [day] of the month for everyone who errs, and for him who is simple: so you shall make atonement for the house.
Translated_sentences: He will also make the seventh day of that month for every one who has sinned by mistake and simplicity; so you will clean the house.

Sentences_from: A napiszę na tablicach onych słowa, które były na tablicach pierwszych, któreś stłukł, a włożysz je do skrzyni.
Sentences_to: I will write on the tables the words that were on the first tables which you broke, and you shall put them in the ark."
Translated_sentences: And I will write on the tablets the words that were on the first tablets, which you broke, and you will put them in the chest.

Sentences_from: On i lud jego z nimi, najsrożsi z narodów, przywiedzeni będą na wytracenie tej ziemi; bo dobędą mieczów swych przeciw Egiptowi, i napełnią ziemię pobitymi.
Sentences_to: He and his people with him, the terrible of the nations, shall be brought in to destroy the land; and they shall draw their swords against Egypt, and fill the land with the slain.
Translated_sentences: He and his people with them, the most dear of the nations, will be brought to the perimation of this earth; for they will take up their swords against Egypt, and fill the earth with the beaten.

Sentences_from: U nóg jej skurczył się, padł, leżał; u nóg jej skurczył się, padł; kędy się skurczył, tam upadł zabity.
Sentences_to: At her feet he bowed, he fell, he lay. At her feet he bowed, he fell. Where he bowed, there he fell down dead.
Translated_sentences: At her feet he shrank, fell, lay down; at her feet he shrank, fell; where he shrunk, there he fell dead.

Sentences_from: A teraz co za sprawę masz na drogach Egipskich, iż pijesz wodę z Nilu? albo co masz za sprawę na drogach Assyryjczyków, iż pijesz wodę z rzeki ich?
Sentences_to: Now what have you to do in the way to Egypt, to drink the waters of the Shihor? Or what have you to do in the way to Assyria, to drink the waters of the River?
Translated_sentences: And now what is the matter on the roads of Egypt that you drink water from the Nile? or what is your case on the roads of the Assyrians that you drink water from their river?

Sentences_from: A tak pobili Żydzi wszystkich nieprzyjaciół swoich, mieczem ich mordując, i tracąc, i niszcząc, a czyniąc z tymi, co ich nienawidzieli, według upodobania swego.
Sentences_to: The Jews struck all their enemies with the stroke of the sword, and with slaughter and destruction, and did what they wanted to those who hated them.
Translated_sentences: And so the Jews defeated all their enemies, murdering them with the sword, and losing them, and destroying them, and doing with those who hated them, as they pleased.

Sentences_from: Przetoż był głód wielki w Samaryi; albowiem ją było oblężono, tak, iż głowę oślą sprzedawano za ośmdziesiąt srebrników, a czwartą część miary gnoju gołębiego za pięć srebrników.
Sentences_to: There was a great famine in Samaria. Behold, they besieged it, until a donkey's head was sold for eighty pieces of silver, and the fourth part of a kab of dove's dung for five pieces of silver.
Translated_sentences: Therefore there was a great famine in Samarya; for it was besieged, so that the head of a donkey was sold for eighty pieces of silver, and a quarter of the measure of pigeon dung for five pieces of silver.

Sentences_from: Ty wysłuchaj z nieba, z miejsca mieszkania twego, a odpuść, i uczyń, i oddaj każdemu według wszelkich dróg jego, które znasz w sercu jego; bo ty, ty sam znasz serca wszystkich synów ludzkich;
Sentences_to: then hear in heaven, your dwelling place, and forgive, and do, and render to every man according to all his ways, whose heart you know; (for you, even you only, know the hearts of all the children of men;)
Translated_sentences: You hear from heaven, from the place of your dwelling place, and forgive, and do, and give to each one according to all his ways, which you know in his heart; for you, you yourself know the hearts of all the sons of men;

Sentences_from: Albowiem on rzekł, i stało się; on rozkazał, a stanęło.
Sentences_to: For he spoke, and it was done. He commanded, and it stood firm.
Translated_sentences: For he said, and it was made; he ordered, and it stopped.

Sentences_from: Wspomnij proszę, kto kiedy niewinny zginął? albo gdzieby ludzie szczerzy zniszczeli?
Sentences_to: "Remember, now, whoever perished, being innocent? Or where were the upright cut off?
Translated_sentences: Please mention who died when an innocent person was killed? or where would sincere people destroy?

Sentences_from: Karyjot wzięte będzie, i zamki wzięte będą, a serce mocarzów Moabskich dnia onego będzie jako serce niewiasty bolejącej.
Sentences_to: Kerioth is taken, and the strongholds are seized, and the heart of the mighty men of Moab at that day shall be as the heart of a woman in her pangs.
Translated_sentences: Caryote will be taken, and the locks will be taken, and the heart of the mighty Moabskis of the day will be as the heart of the sorrowful woman.

Sentences_from: Wszystkie także dziesięciny ziemi z nasienia ziemi, z owocu drzewa, Pańskie są; bo poświęcone są Panu.
Sentences_to: I will destroy your high places, and cut down your incense altars, and cast your dead bodies upon the bodies of your idols; and my soul will abhor you.
Translated_sentences: All the tithes of the earth from the seed of the earth, from the fruit of the tree, are of the Lord; for they are consecrated to the Lord.

Sentences_from: Potem odszedłszy stamtąd dalej przyjdziesz aż na pole Tabor; i spotkają cię tam trzej mężowie idący do Boga, do domu Bożego, jeden niesie troje koźląt, a drugi niesie trzy bochny chleba, a trzeci niesie łagiew wina;
Sentences_to: "Then you shall go on forward from there, and you shall come to the oak of Tabor; and three men shall meet you there going up to God to Bethel, one carrying three young goats, and another carrying three loaves of bread, and another carrying a bottle of wine:
Translated_sentences: Then, having departed from there, you will continue to come all the way to the Tabor field; and there you will meet three men going to God, to the house of God, one carrying three goats, and the other carrying three loaves of bread, and the third carrying a lad of wine;

Sentences_from: A wsi ich były: Etam, i Hain, Remnon, i Tochen i Asan przy tych pięciu miastach;
Sentences_to: Their villages were Etam, and Ain, Rimmon, and Tochen, and Ashan, five cities;
Translated_sentences: And their villages were: Etam, and Hain, Remnon, and Tochen and Asan at these five cities;

Sentences_from: Wtem gdy się sługa twój zabawił tem i owem, oto on zniknął. Tedy rzekł do niego król Izraelski: Taki jest sąd twój, sameś się osądził.
Sentences_to: As your servant was busy here and there, he was gone." The king of Israel said to him, "So your judgment shall be; you yourself have decided it."
Translated_sentences: And when your servant played with this and that, he disappeared. Then said to him the king of Israel, This is your judgment, and you have judged yourself.

Sentences_from: Od mnóstwa koni jego okryje cię proch ich; od grzmotu jezdnych i kar i wozów poruszą się mury twoje, gdy wchodzić będzie w bramy twoje, jako wchodzą do miasta zburzonego.
Sentences_to: By reason of the abundance of his horses their dust shall cover you: your walls shall shake at the noise of the horsemen, and of the wagons, and of the chariots, when he shall enter into your gates, as men enter into a city in which is made a breach.
Translated_sentences: From a multitude of his horses the dust of theirs will cover you; from the thunder of the carriages and the punishments and charioteers thy walls shall move when they enter thy gates as they enter the city destroyed.

Sentences_from: Tak umiejętność mądrości duszy twojej, jeźliże ją znajdziesz; onać będzie nagrodą, a nadzieja twoja nie będzie wycięta.
Sentences_to: so you shall know wisdom to be to your soul; if you have found it, then there will be a reward, your hope will not be cut off.
Translated_sentences: So the ability of the wisdom of your soul, if you find it; it will be a reward, and your hope will not be cut out.

Sentences_from: Praca sprawiedliwego jest ku żywotowi; ale dochód niepobożnych jest ku grzechowi.
Sentences_to: The labor of the righteous leads to life. The increase of the wicked leads to sin.
Translated_sentences: The work of the righteous is for life; but the income of the ungodly is to sin.

Sentences_from: Tak mówi Pan: Dla trzech występków Edoma, owszem, dla czterech, nie przepuszczę mu, przeto, że zepsowawszy w sobie wszelaką litość swoję prześladuje mieczem brata swego, a gniewem swym ustawicznie pała, owszem, zapalczywość jego rozsila się bez przestania;
Sentences_to: Thus says Yahweh: "For three transgressions of Edom, yes, for four, I will not turn away its punishment; because he pursued his brother with the sword, and cast off all pity, and his anger raged continually, and he kept his wrath forever;
Translated_sentences: Thus saith the Lord: For the three transgressions of Edom, yes, for four, I will not forgive him, therefore, that having spoiled all his mercy within himself, he persecutes his brother with the sword, and with his wrath he constantly burns, yes, his fierceness spreads without ceasing;

Sentences_from: Pana, Boga twego, będziesz się bał, jemu służył, przy nim trwał, i przez imię jego przysięgał.
Sentences_to: You shall fear Yahweh your God; you shall serve him; and you shall cling to him, and you shall swear by his name.
Translated_sentences: Thou shalt fear the Lord thy God, serve him, stand by him, and swear by his name.

Sentences_from: A jeźliby kto zabił bydlę wróci inne bydlę za bydlę.
Sentences_to: You shall present with the bread seven lambs without blemish a year old, one young bull, and two rams. They shall be a burnt offering to Yahweh, with their meal offering, and their drink offerings, even an offering made by fire, of a sweet aroma to Yahweh.
Translated_sentences: And if someone killed the cattle, other cattle will return for the cattle.

Sentences_from: Gdy rozdzielił dziedzictwa Najwyższy narodom, a rozsadził syny Adamowe, położył granice narodom według liczby synów Izraelskich;
Sentences_to: You shall return and obey the voice of Yahweh, and do all his commandments which I command you this day.
Translated_sentences: When he distributed the inheritances of the Most High to the nations and scattered the sons of Adam, he laid the boundaries of the nations according to the number of the sons of Israel;

Sentences_from: Aleć on też jest mądry, przetoż przywiedzie złe, a słów swoich nie odmieni; lecz powstanie przeciw domowi złośników i przeciwko ratunkowi tych, którzy broją nieprawość.
Sentences_to: Yet he also is wise, and will bring disaster, and will not call back his words, but will arise against the house of the evildoers, and against the help of those who work iniquity.
Translated_sentences: But he is also wise, therefore he will bring evil, and he will not change his words; but it will rise up against the house of the emass and against the rescue of those who are attesting to iniquity.

Sentences_from: Gdy Izrael obierał sobie bogi nowe, tedy bywała wojna w bramach; tarczy jednak nie było widać, ani drzewca między czterdziestą tysięcy w Izraelu.
Sentences_to: They chose new gods. Then war was in the gates. Was there a shield or spear seen among forty thousand in Israel?
Translated_sentences: When Israel was choosing new gods, there was a war at the gates; but the shield was not visible, nor the spar between the forty thousand in Israel.

Sentences_from: Wspominam sobie i w nocy na imię twoje, Panie! i strzegę zakonu twego.
Sentences_to: I have remembered your name, Yahweh, in the night, and I obey your law.
Translated_sentences: I remember myself and at night your name, Lord! and I guard thy law.

Sentences_from: Dziesięć także tysięcy żywo pojmali synowie Judzcy, i przywiedli ich na wierzch skały, i zrzucili ich z wierzchu skały, aż się wszyscy porozpukali.
Sentences_to: The king and Jehoiada gave it to such as did the work of the service of the house of Yahweh; and they hired masons and carpenters to restore the house of Yahweh, and also such as worked iron and brass to repair the house of Yahweh.
Translated_sentences: Ten thousand were also vividly captured by the sons of Judoka, and brought them to the top of the rock, and threw them off the top of the rock, until they all knocked.

Sentences_from: Jegoż jest morze, bo je on uczynił; i ziemia, którą ręce jego ukształtowały.
Sentences_to: The sea is his, and he made it. His hands formed the dry land.
Translated_sentences: His is the sea, for he made it; and the land that his hands shaped.

Sentences_from: Uczynił i drążki z drzewa sytym, a powlókł je złotem.
Sentences_to: He made poles of acacia wood, and overlaid them with gold.
Translated_sentences: He also made the bars of the tree satiated, and dragged them with gold.

Sentences_from: Tedy Pan zstąpił, aby oglądał miasto ono, i wieżą, którą budowali synowie ludzcy.
Sentences_to: Yahweh came down to see the city and the tower, which the children of men built.
Translated_sentences: Then the Lord came down to see the city and the tower which the sons of men were building.

Sentences_from: Mów do synów Izraelskich, i rzecz im: Jam jest Pan, Bóg wasz.
Sentences_to: "Speak to Aaron, and to his sons, and to all the children of Israel, and say to them: 'This is the thing which Yahweh has commanded,
Translated_sentences: Say to the children of Israel, and it be to them: I am the Lord your God.

Sentences_from: Oto się teraz gotuję do prawa, i wiem, że usprawiedliwiony będę.
Sentences_to: See now, I have set my cause in order. I know that I am righteous.
Translated_sentences: Behold, I am now preparing for the law, and I know that I will be justified.

Sentences_from: W domy synów Manasesa, syna Józefowego poszły za mąż; i tak zostało dziedzictwo ich przy pokoleniu domu ojca ich.
Sentences_to: They were married into the families of the sons of Manasseh the son of Joseph; and their inheritance remained in the tribe of the family of their father.
Translated_sentences: In the homes of the sons of Manases, the son of Joseph, they were married; and so their inheritance remained at the generation of their father's house.

Sentences_from: Uprzedzam cię na świtaniu i wołam, na słowo twoje oczekując.
Sentences_to: I rise before dawn and cry for help. I put my hope in your words.
Translated_sentences: I warn you at dawn and cry out, waiting for your word.

Sentences_from: Jako muchy zdechłe zasmradzają i psują olejek aptekarski: tak człowieka z mądrości i z sławy zacnago trochę głupstwa oszpeca.
Sentences_to: Dead flies cause the oil of the perfumer to send forth an evil odor; so does a little folly outweigh wisdom and honor.
Translated_sentences: As dead flies, they snot and spoil the apothecary oil: so a man with wisdom and fame disfigures a little foolishness.

Sentences_from: Tak iż wszystkich miast, które Lewitom dacie, będzie czterdzieści i osiem miast i z przedmieściami ich.
Sentences_to: "'This shall be your north border: from the great sea you shall mark out for you Mount Hor;
Translated_sentences: So that all the cities that you give to the Levites will be forty and eight cities and with their suburbs.

Sentences_from: Nie będzie mieszkał w domu moim zdrajca, ten, który mówi kłamstwo, nie ostoi się przed oczyma memi.
Sentences_to: He who practices deceit won't dwell within my house. He who speaks falsehood won't be established before my eyes.
Translated_sentences: A traitor will not live in my house, the one who tells a lie will not stand before the eyes of meme.

Sentences_from: Izraelu! ufaj w Panu; bo on jest pomocnikiem ich i tarczą ich.
Sentences_to: Israel, trust in Yahweh! He is their help and their shield.
Translated_sentences: Israel! trust in the Lord; for he is their assistant and their shield.

Sentences_from: Przetoż wyszedł jeden na pole, aby zbierał zioła, i znalazł macicę polną, a nazbierał z niej owoców polnych pełen płaszcz swój, a przyszedłszy nakrajał ich w garniec kaszy; bo tego nie znali.
Sentences_to: One went out into the field to gather herbs, and found a wild vine, and gathered of it wild gourds his lap full, and came and shred them into the pot of stew; for they didn't recognize them.
Translated_sentences: Therefore he went out into the field to collect herbs, and found a field uterus, and gathered from it the fruits of the field a full mantle of his own, and when he came he cut them into a pot of groats; because they didn't know it.

Sentences_from: Przytem rzekł Izajasz: Przynieście bryłę fig suchych. Którą przyniósłszy włożyli na wrzód, i zgoił się.
Sentences_to: Behold, I will put a spirit in him, and he will hear news, and will return to his own land. I will cause him to fall by the sword in his own land."'"
Translated_sentences: And Isaiah said, Bring a lump of dry figs. Which they brought on an ulcer, and it healed.

Sentences_from: A nie mógł się więcej pokrzepić Jeroboam za dni Abijaszowych, i uderzył go Pan, że umarł.
Sentences_to: Jeroboam didn't recover strength again in the days of Abijah. Yahweh struck him, and he died.
Translated_sentences: And Jeroboam could no longer be reassisted in the days of Abijash, and the Lord struck him that he had died.

Sentences_from: Książę Oolibama, książę Ela, książę Pynon.
Sentences_to: chief Oholibamah, chief Elah, chief Pinon,
Translated_sentences: Prince Oolibama, Prince Ela, Prince Pynon.

Sentences_from: Banajas też syn Jojady, syn męża rycerskiego, zacny w swych sprawach, z Kabseel; ten zabił dwóch mocarzów Moabskich, tenże szedłszy zabił lwa w pośrodku studni, we dni śnieżne.
Sentences_to: Benaiah the son of Jehoiada, the son of a valiant man of Kabzeel, who had done mighty deeds, he killed the two sons of Ariel of Moab: he went down also and killed a lion in the midst of a pit in time of snow.
Translated_sentences: Banajas was also the son of Jojada, the son of a knightly man, noble in his affairs, of Kabseel; he killed two mighty Moabskis, the same one on his way killed a lion in the middle of a well, on snowy days.

Sentences_from: Kto strzeże przykazania, nie uzna nic złego; i czas i przyczyny zna serce mądrego.
Sentences_to: Whoever keeps the commandment shall not come to harm, and his wise heart will know the time and procedure.
Translated_sentences: He who keeps the commandment will not recognize anything wrong; and time and causes know the heart of the wise.

Sentences_from: Wyniósł go na wysokie miejsca ziemi, aby używał urodzajów polnych, i uczynił, aby ssał miód z skały i oliwę z opoki twardej;
Sentences_to: Neither is it beyond the sea, that you should say, "Who shall go over the sea for us, and bring it to us, and make us to hear it, that we may do it?"
Translated_sentences: He raised him to the high places of the earth to use the field owl, and made him to suck honey from the rock and the oil from the hard rock;

Sentences_from: Owszem, i po wszystkich winnicach będzie narzekanie, gdy przejdę przez pośrodek ciebie, mówi Pan.
Sentences_to: In all vineyards there will be wailing; for I will pass through the midst of you," says Yahweh.
Translated_sentences: Yes, and in all the vineyards there will be complaining when I pass through the middle of you, saith the Lord.

Sentences_from: Ciebie ja, o Boże ojców moich! wysławiam i chwalę, żeś mi dał mądrość i moc, owszem, żeś mi teraz oznajmił to, o cośmy cię prosili; boś nam sen królewski oznajmił.
Sentences_to: I thank you, and praise you, you God of my fathers, who have given me wisdom and might, and have now made known to me what we desired of you; for you have made known to us the king's matter.
Translated_sentences: You I, O God of my fathers! I praise and praise that you have given me wisdom and power, yes, that you have now told me what we have asked of you; for the king's dream has told us.

Sentences_from: Pieśó stopni. Wołałem do Pana w utrapieniu mojem, a wysłuchał mię.
Sentences_to: < < A Song of Ascents. > > In my distress, I cried to Yahweh. He answered me.
Translated_sentences: A song of degrees. I cried out to the Lord in my affliction, and He listened to me.

Sentences_from: Bo tak mówi Pan: Spustoszona będzie wszystka ziemia, wszakże końca jeszcze nie uczynię.
Sentences_to: For thus says Yahweh, "The whole land shall be a desolation; yet will I not make a full end.
Translated_sentences: For this is what the Lord says: All the earth will be desolate, but I will not make an end yet.

Sentences_from: A ruszywszy się z Kades, położyli się obozem na górze Hor, na granicach ziemi Edomskiej.
Sentences_to: The children of Reuben built Heshbon, and Elealeh, and Kiriathaim,
Translated_sentences: And moving from Kades, they camped on Mount Hor, on the borders of the land of Edom.

Sentences_from: Gdy się zapalą, uczynię im ucztę, i tak ich upoję, że krzyczeć i snem wiecznym zasnąć muszą, tak, aby nie ocucili, mówi Pan.
Sentences_to: When they are heated, I will make their feast, and I will make them drunken, that they may rejoice, and sleep a perpetual sleep, and not wake, says Yahweh.
Translated_sentences: When they are lit, I will make them a feast, and I will so intoxicate them that they must cry out and fall asleep eternally, so that they do not wake up, says the Lord.

Sentences_from: Tedy odpowiedział Helkijasz i rzekł do Safana pisarza: Znalazłem księgi zakonu w domu Pańskim. I oddał Helkijasz księgę Safanowi.
Sentences_to: He took away the foreign gods, and the idol out of the house of Yahweh, and all the altars that he had built in the mountain of the house of Yahweh, and in Jerusalem, and cast them out of the city.
Translated_sentences: Then Helliah replied and said to Safan the writer, "I have found the books of the law in the house of the Lord. And Helkijah gave the book to Safan.

Sentences_from: Poznał tedy wszystek Izrael od Dan aż do Beerseba, iż Samuel był wiernym prorokiem Panu.
Sentences_to: All Israel from Dan even to Beersheba knew that Samuel was established to be a prophet of Yahweh.
Translated_sentences: And he knew all Israel from Dan to Beerseb that Samuel was a faithful prophet to the Lord.

Sentences_from: Dali trupy sług twoich na pokarm ptastwu powietrznemu, ciała świętych twoich bestyjom ziemskim.
Sentences_to: They have given the dead bodies of your servants to be food for the birds of the sky, the flesh of your saints to the animals of the earth.
Translated_sentences: They gave the corpses of your servants for food to the air birds, the bodies of your saints to the earthly beasts.

Sentences_from: Przed Jordanem w ziemi Moabskiej począł Mojżesz wykładać ten zakon, mówiąc:
Sentences_to: Beyond the Jordan, in the land of Moab, began Moses to declare this law, saying,
Translated_sentences: Before the Jordan in the land of Moab, Moses began to teach this law, saying:

Sentences_from: Żona też jego Judaja urodziła Jereda, ojca Giedor, i Hebera, ojca Socho, i Jekutyjela, ojca Zanoach. Cić są synowie Betii, córki Faraonowej, którą był pojął Mered.
Sentences_to: His wife the Jewess bore Jered the father of Gedor, and Heber the father of Soco, and Jekuthiel the father of Zanoah. These are the sons of Bithiah the daughter of Pharaoh, whom Mered took.
Translated_sentences: His wife, Judas, also gave birth to Jaredo, father of Giedor, and heber, father of Socho, and Yekutyjel, father of Zanoach. Cić are the sons of Bethia, the daughter of Pharaoh, who was under concept by Mered.

Sentences_from: I rzekł Pan do Mojżesza: Nie usłucha was Farao, abym rozmnożył cuda moje w ziemi Egipskiej.
Sentences_to: Yahweh said to Moses, "Pharaoh won't listen to you, that my wonders may be multiplied in the land of Egypt."
Translated_sentences: And the Lord said to Moses, Pharaoh will not listen to you, that I may multiply my miracles in the land of Egypt.

Sentences_from: I aż będzie poddana ziemia ona Panu, a potem się wrócicie, i będziecie bez winy przed Panem i przed Izraelem: tedy wam będzie ta ziemia za osiadłość przed obliczem Pańskiem.
Sentences_to: however the gold, and the silver, the brass, the iron, the tin, and the lead,
Translated_sentences: And until the land is subject to the Lord, and then you will return, and you will be blameless before the Lord and before Israel: then you will have this land for settling before the Lord.

Sentences_from: Przeczżeście nie jedli ofiary za grzech na miejscu świętem? albowiem to jest rzecz najświętsza, ponieważ ją wam dano, abyście nosili nieprawość wszystkiego ludu na oczyszczenie ich przed obliczem Pańskiem.
Sentences_to: He presented the meal offering, and filled his hand from there, and burned it upon the altar, besides the burnt offering of the morning.
Translated_sentences: After all, they did not eat the sacrifice for sin on the spot of the feast? for this is the most holy thing, because it has been given to you, that you may bear the iniquity of all the people to purify them before the Lord.

Sentences_from: Pierzem swem okryje cię, a pod skrzydłami jego bezpiecznym będziesz; prawda jego tarczą i puklerzem.
Sentences_to: He will cover you with his feathers. Under his wings you will take refuge. His faithfulness is your shield and rampart.
Translated_sentences: He will cover you with his feathers, and under his wings you will be safe; the truth of his shield and pucker.

Sentences_from: Król Taffua jeden; król Hefer jeden.
Sentences_to: the king of Tappuah, one; the king of Hepher, one;
Translated_sentences: King Taffua one; King Hefer one.

Sentences_from: I wino, które uwesela serce człowiecze, od którego się lśni twarz jako od oleju; i chleb, który zatrzymuje żywot ludzki.
Sentences_to: wine that makes glad the heart of man, oil to make his face to shine, and bread that strengthens man's heart.
Translated_sentences: And the wine that sings the heart of man, from which the face shines as from oil; and the bread that stops human life.

Sentences_from: I Adoraim, i Lachis, i Aseka;
Sentences_to: and Adoraim, and Lachish, and Azekah,
Translated_sentences: And Adoraim, and Lachis, and Aseka;

Sentences_from: Poskoczcie konie, a zagrzmijcie wozy, a niech się ruszą i mocarze, Murzynowie, i Putejczycy noszący tarcz, i Ludymczycy, którzy noszą i ciągną łuk,
Sentences_to: Go up, you horses; and rage, you chariots; and let the mighty men go forth: Cush and Put, who handle the shield; and the Ludim, who handle and bend the bow.
Translated_sentences: Jump the horses, and thunder the wagons, and let the mighty, the Negroes, and the Puteans wearing shields, and the Ludymians, who wear and pull the bow, move,

Sentences_from: Lecz Obededoma i braci ich sześdziesiąt i ośm, Obededoma mówię, syna Jedytunowego, i Hosę, uczynił odźwiernymi.
Sentences_to: and Obed-Edom with their brothers, sixty-eight; Obed-Edom also the son of Jeduthun and Hosah to be doorkeepers;
Translated_sentences: But Obededom and their brothers, their sixteens and eights, Obededom I say, the son of Jedytun, and Hosa, he made doorkeepers.

Sentences_from: Na wierzchu wysokich miejsc, przy drodze i na rozstaniu dróg stoi.
Sentences_to: On the top of high places by the way, where the paths meet, she stands.
Translated_sentences: On top of high places, by the road and on the parting of the roads stands.

Sentences_from: Beser na puszczy, w równinie w ziemi Rubenitów, i Ramot w Galaad między Gadyty, i Golam w Bazan między Manassytami.
Sentences_to: Bezer in the wilderness, in the plain country, for the Reubenites; and Ramoth in Gilead, for the Gadites; and Golan in Bashan, for the Manassites.
Translated_sentences: Beser in the wilderness, in the plain in the land of the Reubenites, and Ramot in Galaad between Gadites, and Golam in Bazan between the Manassites.

Sentences_from: A miast, które dacie z dzierżaw synów Izraelskich, od tych, którzy więcej mają, więcej dacie, a od tych, którzy mniej mają, dacie mniej; każdy według miary dziedzictwa swego, które posiędzie, udzieli z miast swoich Lewitom.
Sentences_to: from Mount Hor you shall mark out to the entrance of Hamath; and the goings out of the border shall be at Zedad;
Translated_sentences: And the cities which you will give from the leases of the sons of Israel, from those who have more, you will give more, and from those who have less, you will give less; each according to the measure of his inheritance which he will inherit, will give from his cities to his Levites.

Sentences_from: I włoży rękę swą na głowę onej ofiary za grzech, i zabije ją na ofiarę za grzech na miejscu, gdzie zabijają ofiary całopalenia.
Sentences_to: He shall lay his hand on the head of the sin offering, and kill it for a sin offering in the place where they kill the burnt offering.
Translated_sentences: And he will put his hand on the head of that sin offering, and he will kill it as a sin offering in the place where they kill the burnt offerings.

Sentences_from: A iżby to opowiedziano i obwołano we wszystkich miastach ich, i w Jeruzalemie, mówiąc: Wynijdźcie na górę, a nanoście gałęzia oliwnego, i gałęzia sosnowego, i gałęzia myrtowego, i gałęzia palmowego, i gałęzia drzewa gęstego, abyście poczynili kuczki, jako jest napisane.
Sentences_to: and that they should publish and proclaim in all their cities, and in Jerusalem, saying, "Go out to the mountain, and get olive branches, and branches of wild olive, and myrtle branches, and palm branches, and branches of thick trees, to make booths, as it is written."
Translated_sentences: And that this be told and proclaimed in all their cities, and in Jerusalem, saying, Come out to the mountain, and come to the olive branch, and the pine branch, and the myrt branch, and the palm branch, and the thick tree branch, that ye may make the squash, as it is written.

Sentences_from: I nawrócisz się do Pana, Boga twego, a będziesz posłuszny głosowi jego we wszystkiem, co ja rozkazuję tobie dziś, ty, i synowie twoi, ze wszystkiego serca twego, i ze wszystkiej duszy twojej:
Sentences_to: and all these blessings shall come on you, and overtake you, if you shall listen to the voice of Yahweh your God.
Translated_sentences: And thou shalt be converted to the Lord thy God, and thou shalt obey his voice in all that I command thee today, you, and thy sons, of all thy heart, and of all thy soul:

Sentences_from: Wzywał tedy Samson Pana, i rzekł: Panie Boże, wspomnij na mię, proszę, a zmocnij mię proszę tylko ten raz; Boże, abym się raz pomścił obu oczu moich nad Filistynami.
Sentences_to: Samson called to Yahweh, and said, "Lord Yahweh, remember me, please, and strengthen me, please, only this once, God, that I may be at once avenged of the Philistines for my two eyes."
Translated_sentences: So Samson called upon the Lord, and said, Lord God, remember me, please, and please strengthen me only this time; God, that I may once adgrege both of my eyes upon the Philistines.

Sentences_from: Wyrwał mię od mocnego nieprzyjaciela mego, i od tych, którzy mię mieli w nienawiści, choć byli mocniejszymi nad mię.
Sentences_to: They came on me in the day of my calamity, but Yahweh was my support.
Translated_sentences: He delivered me from my strong enemy, and from those who hated me, though they were stronger than me.

Sentences_from: Złota, srebra, i miedzi, i żelaza niemasz liczby; wstańże a czyń, a Pan będzie z tobą.
Sentences_to: of the gold, the silver, and the brass, and the iron, there is no number. Arise and be doing, and may Yahweh be with you."
Translated_sentences: Gold, silver, and copper, and iron, you have no number; get up and do, and the Lord will be with you.

Sentences_from: A poznajcie dziś (bo nie mówię do synów waszych, którzy nie znali, ani widzieli karania Pana, Boga waszego); wielmożność jego, rękę jego mocną, i ramię jego wyciągnione;
Sentences_to: Know this day: for I don't speak with your children who have not known, and who have not seen the chastisement of Yahweh your God, his greatness, his mighty hand, and his outstretched arm,
Translated_sentences: And know today (for I am not speaking to your sons, who have not known nor seen the punishment of the Lord your God); his greatness, his strong hand, and his arm stretched out;

Sentences_from: Zstąp, a usiądź w prochu, panno, córko Babiloóska! siądź na ziemi, a nie na stolicy, córko Chaldejska! bo cię nie będą więcej nazywać kochanką i rozkosznicą.
Sentences_to: "Come down, and sit in the dust, virgin daughter of Babylon; sit on the ground without a throne, daughter of the Chaldeans: for you shall no more be called tender and delicate.
Translated_sentences: Come down and sit in the dust, Virgin, daughter of Babylon! sit on the ground, not on the capital, daughter of the Chaldees! for you will no longer be called a lover and a delight.

Sentences_from: A tak przestrzegać będą rozkazania mego, aby nie podlegli grzechowi, i nie pomarli w nim, gdyby się splugawili; Jam Pan, który je poświęcam.
Sentences_to: "'The daughter of any priest, if she profanes herself by playing the prostitute, she profanes her father: she shall be burned with fire.
Translated_sentences: And so they shall keep my commandment, that they should not be subject to sin, and shall not die in it if they should defize themselves; I am the Lord who consecrates them.

Sentences_from: Błogosławiony jest mąż, którego ty ćwiczysz, Panie! a zakonu twego uczysz go.
Sentences_to: Blessed is the man whom you discipline, Yah, and teach out of your law;
Translated_sentences: Blessed is the man whom you train, Lord! and you teach him your law.

Sentences_from: Len tedy i jęczmieó potłuczony jest; bo jęczmieó był niedostały, a len podrastał.
Sentences_to: The flax and the barley were struck, for the barley was in the ear, and the flax was in bloom.
Translated_sentences: Flax and barley are broken; because the barley was not getting any good, and the flax was growing.

Sentences_from: I będzie ofiarował Aaron cielca swego na ofiarę za grzech, i uczyni oczyszczenie za się, i za dom swój.
Sentences_to: He who sits on anything whereon the man who has the discharge sat shall wash his clothes, and bathe himself in water, and be unclean until the evening.
Translated_sentences: And Aaron will offer his bullf as a sacrifice for sin, and he will do purification for himself and for his house.

Sentences_from: I Zabadyjasz, i Arad, i Hader,
Sentences_to: and Zebadiah, and Arad, and Eder,
Translated_sentences: And You Examine, and Arad, and Hader,

Sentences_from: A książęta Filistyńskie ciągnęli stami i tysiącami, a Dawid i mężowie jego ciągnęli pozad z Achisem.
Sentences_to: David said to Achish, "Therefore you shall know what your servant will do." Achish said to David, "Therefore will I make you my bodyguard for ever."
Translated_sentences: And the Philistine princes pulled with hundreds and thousands, and David and his men pulled the pose with Achis.

Sentences_from: Nie dawaj snu oczom twoim, ani drzemania powiekom twoim.
Sentences_to: Give no sleep to your eyes, nor slumber to your eyelids.
Translated_sentences: Do not give sleep to your eyes, nor dozing your eyelids.

Sentences_from: I osiedli ziemię jego, i ziemię Oga, króla Basańskiego, dwóch królów Amorejskich, którzy byli z tej strony Jordanu na wschód słońca;
Sentences_to: They took his land in possession, and the land of Og king of Bashan, the two kings of the Amorites, who were beyond the Jordan toward the sunrise;
Translated_sentences: And they settled the land of him, and the land of Og, king of Basansk, the two kings of Amora, who were on this side of the Jordan for the sunrise;

Sentences_from: Tedy naradziwszy się Amazyjasz, król Judzki, posłał do Joaza, syna Joachaza, syna Jehu, króla Izraelskiego, mówiąc: Pójdź, a wejrzymy sobie w oczy.
Sentences_to: Now after the death of Jehoiada came the princes of Judah, and made obeisance to the king. Then the king listened to them.
Translated_sentences: And then, having consulted, Asia, the king of Judah, sent to Joah, the son of Joachah, the son of Jehu, the king of Israel, saying, "Come, and we shall look into each other's eyes."

Sentences_from: Zebrali się tedy synowie Ammonowi, a położyli się obozem w Galaad; zebrali się też i synowie Izraelscy, a położyli się obozem w Masfa.
Sentences_to: Then the children of Ammon were gathered together, and encamped in Gilead. The children of Israel assembled themselves together, and encamped in Mizpah.
Translated_sentences: The sons of Ammon were gathered together and camped at Galaad; The sons of Israel also gathered and camped in Masfa.

Sentences_from: I rozrzucą je przed słońce, i przed miesiąc, i przed wszystko wojsko niebieskie, które miłują, i którym służą, i za którymi chodzą, i których szukają, i którym się kłaniają; nie pozbierają ich, ani pogrzebią, ale będą miasto gnoju na wierzchu ziem i.
Sentences_to: and they shall spread them before the sun, and the moon, and all the army of the sky, which they have loved, and which they have served, and after which they have walked, and which they have sought, and which they have worshiped: they shall not be gathered, nor be buried, they shall be for dung on the surface of the earth.
Translated_sentences: And they will scatter them before the sun, and before a month ago, and before all, the heavenly army, which they love, and serve, and whom they walk, and whom they seek, and to whom they bow; they will not collect them or bury them, but they will be a city of dung on top of the lands and.

Sentences_from: Ruszyli się potem z Elimu, i przyszło wszystko mnóstwo synów Izraelskich na puszczą Zyn, która leży między Elim i między Synaj, piętnastego dnia miesiąca wtórego po wyjściu ich z ziemi Egipskiej.
Sentences_to: They took their journey from Elim, and all the congregation of the children of Israel came to the wilderness of Sin, which is between Elim and Sinai, on the fifteenth day of the second month after their departing out of the land of Egypt.
Translated_sentences: Then they moved from Elimu, and all the multitude of the sons of Israel came to the wilderness of Zin, which lies between Elim and between Sinai, on the fifteenth day of the Second Month after their departure from the land of Egypt.

Sentences_from: I wyleję gorliwość moję na cię, i obejdą się z tobą zapalczywie, nos twój i uszy twoje oberżną, a ostatek twój od miecza polegnie; oni synów twoich i córki twoje pojmają, a ostatek twój ogniem pożarty będzie;
Sentences_to: I will set my jealousy against you, and they shall deal with you in fury; they shall take away your nose and your ears; and your residue shall fall by the sword: they shall take your sons and your daughters; and your residue shall be devoured by the fire.
Translated_sentences: And I will pour out my zeal upon you, and they shall deal with you with zeal, your nose and your ears shall be afflict, and your remnant shall fall from the sword; they shall take thy sons and daughters, and thy remnant shall be devoured by fire;

Sentences_from: Zabłyśnij błyskawicą, a rozprosz ich; puść strzały twoje, a poraź ich.
Sentences_to: Throw out lightning, and scatter them. Send out your arrows, and rout them.
Translated_sentences: Shine with lightning and scatter them; let go of your arrows, and smid them.

Sentences_from: I wspomną na mię, którzy z was zachowani będą między narodami, u krórych będą w pojmaniu, żem ubolewał nad sercem ich wszetecznem, które odstąpiło odemnie, i nad oczyma ich, które nierząd płodziły, chodząc za plugawemi bałwanami swojemi: i omierzną sami sobie dla złości, które czynili we wszystkich obrzydliwościach swoich.
Sentences_to: Those of you that escape shall remember me among the nations where they shall be carried captive, how that I have been broken with their lewd heart, which has departed from me, and with their eyes, which play the prostitute after their idols: and they shall loathe themselves in their own sight for the evils which they have committed in all their abominations.
Translated_sentences: And they will remember which of you will be preserved among the nations, among the most likely to be captured, that I mourn over their fornication heart, which has departed from me, and over their eyes, which fornication have beneath, following their filthy idols: and they will take care of themselves for the anger which they have done in all their abominations.

Sentences_from: A tak wzięli cielca, którego im dał, a zgotowawszy wzywali imienia Baalowego od poranku aż do południa, mówiąc: O Baalu, wysłuchaj nas! Ale nie było głosu, ani ktoby odpowiedział. I skakali koło ołtarza, który byli uczynili.
Sentences_to: They took the bull which was given them, and they dressed it, and called on the name of Baal from morning even until noon, saying, Baal, hear us. But there was no voice, nor any who answered. They leaped about the altar which was made.
Translated_sentences: And so they took the bullock which he had given them, and having prepared them, they invoked the name of Baal from morning until noon, saying, O Baal, hear us! But there was no voice, no one to answer. And they jumped near the altar that they had made.

Sentences_from: Kto wie, jeźli się nie obróci Bóg, a nie użali się tego, nie odwrócili się, mówię, od popędliwości gniewu swego, abyśmy nie zginęli.
Sentences_to: But I will sacrifice to you with the voice of thanksgiving. I will pay that which I have vowed. Salvation belongs to Yahweh."
Translated_sentences: Who knows, if God did not turn around and did not complain about it, they did not turn away, I say, from the impetus of their wrath, lest we perish.

Sentences_from: A ten miał trzydzieści synów, którzy jeździli na trzydziestu ośląt, a mieli trzydzieści miast, które zwano Awot Jair aż po dzisiejszy dzień w ziemi Galaadskiej.
Sentences_to: He had thirty sons who rode on thirty donkey colts, and they had thirty cities, which are called Havvoth Jair to this day, which are in the land of Gilead.
Translated_sentences: And he had thirty sons who rode thirty donkeys, and they had thirty cities, which were called Avot Jairus up to this day in the land of Galaads.

Sentences_from: W oneż dni widziałem w Judzie tłoczących prasy w sabat, i noszących snopy, które kładli na osły, także i winne grona, i figi, i wszelki ciężar, a przynoszących do Jeruzalemu w dzień sabatu, i zgromiłem ich onegoż dnia, którego sprzedawali żywność.
Sentences_to: In those days saw I in Judah some men treading winepresses on the Sabbath, and bringing in sheaves, and loading donkeys; as also wine, grapes, and figs, and all kinds of burdens, which they brought into Jerusalem on the Sabbath day: and I testified against them in the day in which they sold food.
Translated_sentences: On those days I saw in Judah crowding the presses on the Sabbath, and wearing sheaves, which they put on donkeys, also wine grapes, and figs, and all burdens, and bringing to Jerusalem on the Sabbath day, and I rebuke them on the day they sold food.

Sentences_from: Ja zaiste jestem Pan, Bóg twój, który rozdzielam morze, tak, że szumią wały jego; Pan zastępów jest imię moje.
Sentences_to: For I am Yahweh your God, who stirs up the sea, so that its waves roar: Yahweh of Armies is his name.
Translated_sentences: Indeed, I am the Lord your God, who divides the sea so that its ramparts roach; The Lord of hosts is my name.

Sentences_from: Wyrwij mię od tych, którzy broją nieprawość, a od mężów krwawych wybaw mię.
Sentences_to: For, behold, they lie in wait for my soul. The mighty gather themselves together against me, not for my disobedience, nor for my sin, Yahweh.
Translated_sentences: Deliver me from those who are advocacy, and deliver me from bloody men.

Sentences_from: A synowie Izraelscy rozrodzili się, i rozpłodzili się, i rozmnożyli się, i zmocnili się bardzo wielce, a napełniona jest ziemia nimi.
Sentences_to: The children of Israel were fruitful, and increased abundantly, and multiplied, and grew exceedingly mighty; and the land was filled with them.
Translated_sentences: And the sons of Israel were born, and they were befed, and they multiplied, and they became very strong, and the earth is filled with them.

Sentences_from: Tedy rozkazał Pan Bóg człowiekowi, mówiąc: Z każdego drzewa sadu jeść będziesz.
Sentences_to: Yahweh God commanded the man, saying, "Of every tree of the garden you may freely eat;
Translated_sentences: Then the Lord God commanded man, saying, "From every tree of the orchard thou shy thou shy."

Sentences_from: A gdyby się prorok dał zwieść, aby mówił słowo, Ja Pan zwiodłem proroka onego, i wyciągnę nań rękę swoję, i wygładzę go z pośrodku ludu mego Izraelskiego.
Sentences_to: If the prophet is deceived and speak a word, I, Yahweh, have deceived that prophet, and I will stretch out my hand on him, and will destroy him from the midst of my people Israel.
Translated_sentences: And if the prophet should be deceived into speaking the word, I have deceived the prophet, and I will stretch out my hand upon him, and I will smooth him out of the midst of my people Israel.

Sentences_from: Zna wół gospodarza swego, i osieł żłób pana swego; ale Izrael mię nie zna, lud mój nie zrozumiewa.
Sentences_to: The ox knows his owner, and the donkey his master's crib; but Israel doesn't know, my people don't consider."
Translated_sentences: He knows the ox of his host, and the manger of his master; but Israel does not know me, my people do not understand.

Sentences_from: Rozdzielił tedy one trzy sta mężów na trzy hufce, a dał trąby w ręce każdemu z nich, i dzbany czcze, i pochodnie w pośrodek dzbanów
Sentences_to: He divided the three hundred men into three companies, and he put into the hands of all of them trumpets, and empty pitchers, with torches within the pitchers.
Translated_sentences: He then divided the three sta men into three troops, and gave trumpets in the hands of each of them, and pitchers of worship, and torches in the middle of the jugs.

Sentences_from: Tać będzie powinność domów synów Gersonowych w namiocie zgromadzenia, a będzie ich doglądał Itamar, syn Aarona kapłana.
Sentences_to: This is the service of the families of the sons of the Gershonites in the Tent of Meeting: and their duty shall be under the hand of Ithamar the son of Aaron the priest.
Translated_sentences: It will be the duty of the homes of the sons of Gerson in the tent of the congregation, and they will be looked after by Itamar, the son of Aaron the priest.

Sentences_from: Teraz stworzone są, a nie onego czasu, o którycheś przed tym dniem nic nie słyszał, byś snać nie rzekł: Otom wiedział o tem.
Sentences_to: They are created now, and not from of old; and before this day you didn't hear them; lest you should say, 'Behold, I knew them.'
Translated_sentences: Now they are created, and not of that time, of which you had heard nothing before that day, so that you could not say, Otto knew of this.

Sentences_from: Przetoż wziął Johanan, syn Kareaszowy, i wszyscy książęta wojsk, którzy z nim byli, wszystek ostatek ludu, który zaś przywiódł od Izmaela, syna Natanijaszowego, z Masfy, gdy zabił Godolijasza, syna Ahikamowego, mężów walecznych, i niewiasty, i dziatki, i komorników, których zaś przywiódł z Gabaonu.
Sentences_to: Then took Johanan the son of Kareah, and all the captains of the forces who were with him, all the remnant of the people whom he had recovered from Ishmael the son of Nethaniah, from Mizpah, after that he had killed Gedaliah the son of Ahikam, the men of war, and the women, and the children, and the eunuchs, whom he had brought back from Gibeon:
Translated_sentences: Therefore he took Johanan, the son of Kareash, and all the princes of the armies who were with him, all the remnant of the people, who he brought from Ishmael, the son of Nathaniyah, from Masfa, when he killed Godoliyas, the son of Ahikam, men of valiant men, and women, and children, and bailiffs, whom he brought from Gabaon.

Sentences_from: Króle też Madyjańskie pobili między inszymi pobitymi ich, Ewiego, i Rechema, i Sura, i Hura, i Rebaha, pięciu królów Madyjańskich, i Balaama, syna Beorowego, zabili mieczem.
Sentences_to: But if her husband forbids her in the day that he hears it, then he shall make void her vow which is on her, and the rash utterance of her lips, with which she has bound her soul: and Yahweh will forgive her.
Translated_sentences: The Madian kings also beat them, Ewi, and Rechem, and Surah, and Hurah, and Rebah, the five Madian kings, and Balaam, the son of Beor, among the other who were beaten, with the sword.

Sentences_from: Albowiem czyhali na twoje złe; zmyślali radę, której dowieść nie mogli.
Sentences_to: For you will make them turn their back, when you aim drawn bows at their face.
Translated_sentences: For they were waiting for your evil; they were making up advice that they couldn't prove.

Sentences_from: A teć są imiona synów Giersonowych, Lobni i Semei.
Sentences_to: The sons of Kohath: Amram, Izhar, and Hebron, and Uzziel.
Translated_sentences: And these are the names of the sons of Gierson, Lobni and Semei.

Sentences_from: I rzekła ona druga niewiasta: Nie tak; ale syn mój jest ten żywy, a syn twój ten umarły. Ale ona rzekła: Nie; ale syn twój jest ten umarły, a syn mój ten żywy. I tak się spierały przed królem.
Sentences_to: The other woman said, "No; but the living is my son, and the dead is your son." This said, "No; but the dead is your son, and the living is my son." Thus they spoke before the king.
Translated_sentences: And the second woman said, Not so; but my son is alive, and your son is dead. But she said, No; but your son is dead, and my son is alive. And so they argued before the king.

Sentences_from: Który to lud podał niezbożnym grób jego, a bogatemu śmierć jego, choć jednak nieprawości nie uczynił, ani zdrada znaleziona jest w ustach jego.
Sentences_to: They made his grave with the wicked, and with a rich man in his death; although he had done no violence, neither was any deceit in his mouth.
Translated_sentences: Which people gave his tomb to the unsusty, and to the rich his death, though he did not do iniquity, nor is treason found in his mouth.

Sentences_from: Ziemia wasza spustoszona, miasta wasze popalone ogniem. Ziemię waszę cudzoziemcy przed wami pożerają i pustoszą, jako zwykli cudzoziemcy.
Sentences_to: Your country is desolate. Your cities are burned with fire. Strangers devour your land in your presence, and it is desolate, as overthrown by strangers.
Translated_sentences: Your land is desolate, your cities burned by fire. Your land is devoured and emptied by foreigners before you, as ordinary foreigners.

Sentences_from: Przetoż i dobytek nasz pójdzie z nami, a nie zostanie i kopyto; albowiem z tego weźmiemy do służby Panu, Bogu naszemu; bo my nie wiemy, czem służyć mamy Panu, aż tam przyjdziemy.
Sentences_to: Our livestock also shall go with us. Not a hoof shall be left behind, for of it we must take to serve Yahweh our God; and we don't know with what we must serve Yahweh, until we come there."
Translated_sentences: Therefore our possessions will go with us, and not the hoof; for from this we shall come to the service of the Lord our God; for we do not know how to serve the Lord until we come there.

Sentences_from: Wyleje jako deszcz na niepobożnych sidła, ogieó i siarkę, a wicher będzie cząstką kielicha ich.
Sentences_to: On the wicked he will rain blazing coals; fire, sulfur, and scorching wind shall be the portion of their cup.
Translated_sentences: It will pour out as rain on the ungodly snare, ogieó and brimtrum, and the wither will be a part of their cup.

Sentences_from: Kain, Gabaa, i Tamna, miast dziesięć, i wsi ich.
Sentences_to: Kain, Gibeah, and Timnah; ten cities with their villages.
Translated_sentences: Cain, Gabaa, and Tamna, ten cities, and villages theirs.

Sentences_from: Albowiem Ja znam sprawy ich, i myśli ich; i przyjdzie ten czas, że zgromadzę wszystkie narody, i języki, i przyjdą a oglądają chwałę moję.
Sentences_to: "For I know their works and their thoughts: the time comes, that I will gather all nations and languages; and they shall come, and shall see my glory.
Translated_sentences: For I know their affairs, and they think; and the time will come when I will gather all nations and tongues, and they will come and see my glory.

Sentences_from: A wziąwszy Józef obydwu, postawił Efraima po prawej ręce swojej, a po lewej Izraelowej; a Manasesa po lewej ręce swojej a po prawej Izraelowej, i przywiódł je do niego.
Sentences_to: Joseph took them both, Ephraim in his right hand toward Israel's left hand, and Manasseh in his left hand toward Israel's right hand, and brought them near to him.
Translated_sentences: And taking Joseph both, he placed Ephraim on his right hand and israel's left; and Manases on his left hand and Israel's right hand, and brought them to him.

Sentences_from: A tak bieżał jezdny przeciwko niemu, i rzekł: Tak mówi król: A pokój? I odpowiedział Jehu: Co tobie do pokoju? Obróć się, jedź za mną. Przetoż oznajmił stróż mówiąc: Dojechałci poseł do nich, ale się nie wraca.
Sentences_to: So there went one on horseback to meet him, and said, "Thus says the king, 'Is it peace?'" Jehu said, "What do you have to do with peace? Fall in behind me!" The watchman said, "The messenger came to them, but he isn't coming back."
Translated_sentences: And so the rider ran against him, and said, Thus saith the king, And peace? And Jehu answered, What do you have to peace? Turn around, follow me. So the watchman said, "You have come to them, but you are not coming back."

Sentences_from: A tak i Ja odkryję podołek twój aż na twarz twoję, aby się okazała sromota twoja.
Sentences_to: Therefore will I also uncover your skirts on your face, and your shame shall appear.
Translated_sentences: And so I will discover your underseath to your face, that your severom will be revealed.

Sentences_from: A oto, słudzy Dawidowi i Joab wracali się z wojny, korzyści wielkie z sobą prowadząc, ale Abnera już nie było u Dawida w Hebronie: bo go był odprawił, i odszedł był w pokoju.
Sentences_to: Behold, the servants of David and Joab came from a foray, and brought in a great spoil with them: but Abner was not with David in Hebron; for he had sent him away, and he was gone in peace.
Translated_sentences: And behold, the servants of David and Joab were returning from the war, great benefits leading with each other, but Abner was no longer with David in Hebron: for he had dismissed him, and he had gone he was at peace.

Sentences_from: I rzekł Saul do Achijasa: Przystaw skrzynię Bożą; (bo była skrzynia Boża dnia onego z syny Izraelskimi.)
Sentences_to: Saul said to Ahijah, "Bring the ark of God here." For the ark of God was with the children of Israel at that time.
Translated_sentences: And Saul said to Achiyas, Put the chest of God; (for there was a chest of God on that day with the sons of Israel.)

Sentences_from: A synom Izraelskim tak powiesz, mówiąc: Olejek pomazywania świętego mnie będzie świętym w narodziech waszych;
Sentences_to: You shall speak to the children of Israel, saying, 'This shall be a holy anointing oil to me throughout your generations.
Translated_sentences: And to the children of Israel you will say this, saying, The oil of anointing the holy one of me will be holy in your nations;

Sentences_from: Gdy siądziesz, abyś jadł z panem, uważaj pilnie, kto jest przed tobą;
Sentences_to: When you sit to eat with a ruler, consider diligently what is before you;
Translated_sentences: When you sit down to eat with the master, be diligent in who is in front of you;

Sentences_from: A gdy się wrócili do niego, (a on mieszkał w Jerycho,)rzekł do nich: Azażem wam nie mówił: Nie chodźcie?
Sentences_to: They came back to him, while he stayed at Jericho; and he said to them, "Didn't I tell you, 'Don't go?'"
Translated_sentences: And when they returned to him (and he lived in Jerycho,) he said to them, Azage did not say to you, "Do not come?

Sentences_from: Tedy Jonasz począł chodzić po mieście, ile mógł za jeden dzień ujść, i wołał mówiąc: Po czterdziestu dniach Niniwe będzie wywrócone.
Sentences_to: I said, 'I have been banished from your sight; yet I will look again toward your holy temple.'
Translated_sentences: So Jonah began to walk around the city as much as he could get away in a day, and cried out, Saying, After forty days Nineveh will be overturned.

Sentences_from: I pobił ich król Babiloński, a pomordował ich w Ryblacie w ziemi Emat. A tak przeniesiony jest Juda z ziemi swojej.
Sentences_to: The king of Babylon struck them, and put them to death at Riblah in the land of Hamath. So Judah was carried away captive out of his land.
Translated_sentences: And the king of Babylon beat them, and murdered them in Ryblacie in the land of Emat. And so Judah is transferred from his land.

Sentences_from: Znowu zaczął przypowieść swoję, i rzekł: Ach! któż będzie żyw, gdy to uczyni Bóg?
Sentences_to: He took up his parable, and said, "Alas, who shall live when God does this?
Translated_sentences: He began his parable again, and said, Ae! who will be alive when God does this?

Sentences_from: A tak odprowadzili zasię Sadok i Abijatar skrzynię Bożą do Jeruzalemu, i zostali tam.
Sentences_to: Zadok therefore and Abiathar carried the ark of God again to Jerusalem; and they stayed there.
Translated_sentences: And so they led Sadok and Abijatar to The Chest of God to Jerusalem, and they stayed there.

Sentences_from: Oczyść mię, isopem, a oczyszczon będę; omyj mię, a nad śnieg wybielony będę.
Sentences_to: Hide your face from my sins, and blot out all of my iniquities.
Translated_sentences: Purify me, isopem, and I will be cleansed; wash me and I will be whitened over the snow.

Sentences_from: Cóż się przechwalasz dolinami? Spłynęła dolina twoja, o córko uporna! która ufasz w skarbach twoich, mówiąc: Któż przyciągnie przeciwko mnie?
Sentences_to: Why do you glory in the valleys, your flowing valley, backsliding daughter? who trusted in her treasures, saying, Who shall come to me?
Translated_sentences: What are you bragging about in the valleys? Your valley has flowed, O stubborn daughter! who trusts in your treasures, saying, Who will draw against me?

Sentences_from: Potłukł gradem szczepy ich, a drzewa leśnych fig ich gradem lodowym.
Sentences_to: He destroyed their vines with hail, their sycamore fig trees with frost.
Translated_sentences: He broke their strains with hail, and the trees of forest figs with their ice hail.

Sentences_from: A rzecze do nich: Słuchaj Izraelu, wy dziś staczacie bitwę z nieprzyjacioły waszymi; niechajże nie słabieje serce wasze, nie bójcie się i nie trwożcie sobą, ani się ich lękajcie;
Sentences_to: You shall prepare you the way, and divide the borders of your land, which Yahweh your God causes you to inherit, into three parts, that every manslayer may flee there.
Translated_sentences: And he said to them: Listen to Israel, today you are fighting a battle with your enemies; let not your heart be weakened, do not fear or fear yourselves;

Sentences_from: Będzie błogosławił tym, którzy się boją Pana, małym i wielkim.
Sentences_to: He will bless those who fear Yahweh, both small and great.
Translated_sentences: He will bless those who fear the Lord, small and great.

Sentences_from: A tak zabijcie baranka wielkanocnego, a poświęćcie się, i przygotujcie braci waszych, sprawując się według słowa Pańskiego, podanego przez Mojżesza.
Sentences_to: He did this in the cities of Manasseh and Ephraim and Simeon, even to Naphtali, around in their ruins.
Translated_sentences: And so kill the Lamb of Easter, and sacrifice yourselves, and prepare your brethren, keeping according to the word of the Lord given by Moses.

Sentences_from: I stało się, gdy był czas sprawowania ofiary śniednej, przystąpił Elijasz prorok, i rzekł: Panie, Boże Abrahama, Izaaka, i Izraela! dziś niech poznają, żeś ty jest Bogiem w Izraelu, a jam sługa twój, a żem według słowa twego uczynił to wszystko.
Sentences_to: It happened at the time of the offering of the offering, that Elijah the prophet came near, and said, "Yahweh, the God of Abraham, of Isaac, and of Israel, let it be known this day that you are God in Israel, and that I am your servant, and that I have done all these things at your word.
Translated_sentences: And it happened when it was time to celebrate the sacrifice of the Dreamer, and the prophet Elyiah came, and said, Lord, God of Abraham, isaac, and Israel! today let them know that you are God in Israel, and I am your servant, and that according to your word I have done all this.

Sentences_from: Kapłanów jego przyoblokę zbawieniem, a święci jego weseląc się, radować się będą.
Sentences_to: Her priests I will also clothe with salvation. Her saints will shout aloud for joy.
Translated_sentences: I will block his priests with salvation, and the saints will rejoice in his rejoicing.

Sentences_from: Także wszyscy starsi miasta onego, które jest najbliższe zabitego, umyją ręce swoje nad jałowicą ściętą w dolinie;
Sentences_to: What man is there who has planted a vineyard, and has not used its fruit? Let him go and return to his house, lest he die in the battle, and another man use its fruit.
Translated_sentences: Also all the elders of the city of that which is closest to the slain will wash their hands over the juniper cut down in the valley;

Sentences_from: I dał mu znak dnia onegoż, mówiąc: Tenci jest znak, że to mówił Pan: Oto się ołtarz rozpadnie, a wysypie się popiół, który jest na nim.
Sentences_to: He gave a sign the same day, saying, "This is the sign which Yahweh has spoken: Behold, the altar will be split apart, and the ashes that are on it will be poured out."
Translated_sentences: And he gave him the sign of the day, saying: Tenci there is a sign that the Lord said: Behold, the altar will fall apart, and the ashes that are on it will spill out.

Sentences_from: Z ręki grobu wybawię ich, od śmierci wykupię ich. O śmierci! będę śmiercią twoją; o grobie! będę skażeniem twojem; żałość skryta będzie od oczów moich.
Sentences_to: Ephraim has bitterly provoked anger. Therefore his blood will be left on him, and his Lord will repay his contempt.
Translated_sentences: From the hand of the grave I will save them, from death I will redeem them. O death! I will be your death; about the grave! I will be your contamination; sorrow will be hidden from my eyes.

Sentences_from: Na szyi swej prześladowanie cierpiemy, pracujemy, a nie dadzą nam odpocząć.
Sentences_to: Our pursuers are on our necks: We are weary, and have no rest.
Translated_sentences: On the neck of our persecution we suffer, we work, and they will not give us rest.

Sentences_from: Także i Lewitowie, którzy się oddalali odemnie, gdy błądził Izrael, którzy się obłądzili odemnie za plugawemi bałwanami swemi, ci poniosą nieprawość swoję.
Sentences_to: But the Levites who went far from me, when Israel went astray, who went astray from me after their idols, they shall bear their iniquity.
Translated_sentences: Even the Levites, who distanced themselves from me when Israel wandered, who went mad from me for their filthy idols, will bear their iniquity.

Sentences_from: Mówi w sercu swem: Nie będę wzruszony od narodu do narodu; bo się nie boję złego.
Sentences_to: He says in his heart, "I shall not be shaken. For generations I shall have no trouble."
