Sentences_from: A poszedłszy, służyłby obcym bogom, i kłaniałby się im, albo słoócu, albo miesiącowi, albo wszystkim zastępom niebieskim, czegom nie przykazał;
Sentences_to: You shall eat no leavened bread with it. You shall eat unleavened bread with it seven days, even the bread of affliction; for you came forth out of the land of Egypt in haste: that you may remember the day when you came forth out of the land of Egypt all the days of your life.
Translated_sentences: And ever he had gone, he would have served the foreign gods, and bowed down to them, either to the sun, or to the month, or to all the hosts of heaven, which he did not command;

Sentences_from: A Sammaj był synem Maonowym, a Maon był ojcem Betsurczyków.
Sentences_to: The son of Shammai was Maon; and Maon was the father of Beth Zur.
Translated_sentences: And Sammai was the son of the Maon, and Maon was the father of the Bethsurians.

Sentences_from: Ale wieża była mocna w pośrodku miasta, na którą uciekli wszyscy mężowie, i niewiasty, i wszyscy przedniejsi miasta, a zamknąwszy ją za sobą, weszli na dach wieży.
Sentences_to: But there was a strong tower within the city, and there fled all the men and women, and all they of the city, and shut themselves in, and went up to the roof of the tower.
Translated_sentences: But the tower was strong in the middle of the city, to which all the men fled, and the women, and all the front of the city, and having closed it behind them, they entered the roof of the tower.

Sentences_from: Tedy Jonatan pobił straż Filistyóską, która była w Gabaa, i usłyszeli Filistynowie. Zatem Saul zatrąbił w trąbę po wszystkiej ziemi, mówiąc: Niech usłyszą Hebrejczycy.
Sentences_to: Jonathan struck the garrison of the Philistines that was in Geba: and the Philistines heard of it. Saul blew the trumpet throughout all the land, saying, "Let the Hebrews hear!"
Translated_sentences: So Jonathan beat up the Philistine guard that was in Gabaa, and the Philistines heard. So Saul trumpeted the trumpet all over the earth, saying, Let the Hebrews hear.

Sentences_from: I rzekli: Dwanaście nas braci było sług twoich, synów jednego męża w ziemi Chananejskiej; a oto, najmłodszy z ojcem naszym teraz jest w domu, a jednego już nie masz.
Sentences_to: They said, "We, your servants, are twelve brothers, the sons of one man in the land of Canaan; and behold, the youngest is this day with our father, and one is no more."
Translated_sentences: And they said, Twelve of us brethren were your servants, sons of one man in the land of Canaan; and behold, the youngest with our father is now at home, and you no longer have one.

Sentences_from: Rzekł tedy Pan do Mojżesza: Zbierz wszystkie książęta z ludu, a każ im, te przestępce powieszać Panu przed słońcem, aby się odwrócił gniew popędliwości Pańskiej od Izraela.
Sentences_to: Yahweh said to Moses, "Take all the chiefs of the people, and hang them up to Yahweh before the sun, that the fierce anger of Yahweh may turn away from Israel."
Translated_sentences: And the Lord said to Moses, Gather all the princes of the people, and command them, these criminals, to hang the Lord before the sun, that the wrath of the Lord's impetus may be turned away from Israel.

Sentences_from: Nie wnośże obrzydliwości w dom twój, abyś się nie stał przeklęstwem, jako i ona; wielce się nią brzydzić będziesz, i bardzo ją sobie obmierzysz, ponieważ przeklęstwem jest.
Sentences_to: You shall not bring an abomination into your house, and become a devoted thing like it. You shall utterly detest it, and you shall utterly abhor it; for it is a devoted thing.
Translated_sentences: I do not bring an abomination into your house, lest you become a curse as she did; You will be very disgusted with it, and you will be very fond of it, because it is a curse.

Sentences_from: Potem mężowie Izraelscy wróciwszy się do synów Benjaminowych, wybili je ostrzem miecza, w mieście, począwszy od ludzi aż do bydlęcia, i do wszystkiego, co znaleźli; przytem i wszystkie miasta, które pozostały, popalili ogniem.
Sentences_to: The men of Israel turned again on the children of Benjamin, and struck them with the edge of the sword, both the entire city, and the livestock, and all that they found: moreover all the cities which they found they set on fire.
Translated_sentences: Then the men of Israel, returning to the sons of Benjamin, sought them out with the blade of the sword, in the city, from men to cattle, and to all that they found; and all the cities that remained were burned with fire.

Sentences_from: Dlatego tak mówi panujący Pan: Otom Ja powstał przeciwko tobie, o Tyrze! a przywiodę na cię wiele narodów, jakobym przywiódł morze z nawałnościami jego;
Sentences_to: therefore thus says the Lord Yahweh, Behold, I am against you, Tyre, and will cause many nations to come up against you, as the sea causes its waves to come up.
Translated_sentences: That is why the reigning Lord says: Otom I have risen against you, O Tyer! and I will bring upon you many nations, as if I have brought the sea with its storms;

Sentences_from: Matatyjasz też z Lewitów, pierworodny Salluma Korytczyka, był przełożony nad rzeczami, które w panwiach smażono.
Sentences_to: Mattithiah, one of the Levites, who was the firstborn of Shallum the Korahite, had the office of trust over the things that were baked in pans.
Translated_sentences: Matatyyash of the Levites, the firstborn of Sallum Korytczyk, was superior to the things that were fried in panwiach.

Sentences_from: Z pokolenia Efraimowego Ozeasz, syn Nunów.
Sentences_to: Of the tribe of Ephraim, Hoshea the son of Nun.
Translated_sentences: From the tribe of Ephraim, Sheze, the son of the Nuns.

Sentences_from: Oto strach mój nie zatrwoży cię, a ręka moja nie obciąży cię.
Sentences_to: Behold, my terror shall not make you afraid, neither shall my pressure be heavy on you.
Translated_sentences: Behold, my fear will not alarm you, and my hand will not burden you.

Sentences_from: Uczynił też zasłonę do drzwi namiotu z hijacyntu, i z szarłatu, i z karmazynu dwa kroć farbowanego, i z białego jedwabiu kręconego, robotą haftarską.
Sentences_to: He made a screen for the door of the tent, of blue, purple, scarlet, and fine twined linen, the work of an embroiderer;
Translated_sentences: He also made a curtain for the door of the tent of hyacinth, and of amaranth, and of crimson two slices of dyed, and of white curly silk, embroidery work.

Sentences_from: Otoś mędrszym nad Danijela, żadna tajemnica nie jest zakryta przed tobą,
Sentences_to: behold, you are wiser than Daniel; there is no secret that is hidden from you;
Translated_sentences: Behold the wiser over Danijela, no mystery is hidden from you,

Sentences_from: Postawże nad nim bezbożnika, a przeciwnik niech stoi po prawej ręce jego.
Sentences_to: Set a wicked man over him. Let an adversary stand at his right hand.
Translated_sentences: Put the ungodly over him, and let the adversary stand on his right hand.

Sentences_from: Wstań, poświęć lud i rzeczy: Poświęćcie się na jutro; bo tak mówi Pan, Bóg Izraelski: Przeklęstwo jest w pośrodku ciebie, Izraelu; nie ostoisz się przed nieprzyjacioły twymi, aż odejmiecie przeklęstwo z pośrodku siebie.
Sentences_to: "Get up! Sanctify the people, and say, 'Sanctify yourselves for tomorrow, for Yahweh, the God of Israel, says, "There is a devoted thing in the midst of you, Israel. You cannot stand before your enemies until you take away the devoted thing from among you."
Translated_sentences: Arise, sacrifice the people and things: Sacrifice yourselves for tomorrow; for thus saith the Lord, the God of Israel: The curse is in the midst of you, Israel; you will not stand before your enemies until you subtrace the curse from the midst of yourself.

Sentences_from: I uczynił go królem nad Gaaladem, i nad Assury, i nad Jezreelem, i nad Efraimem, i nad Benjaminem, i nad wszystkim Izraelem.
Sentences_to: and he made him king over Gilead, and over the Ashurites, and over Jezreel, and over Ephraim, and over Benjamin, and over all Israel.
Translated_sentences: And he made him king over Gaalad, and over Assura, and over Jezreel, and over Ephraim, and over Benjamin, and over all Israel.

Sentences_from: Tedy on rzekł: Niechże tak będzie, jako mówicie; jednak przy którym się znajdzie kubek, ten niech będzie niewolnikiem, a wy będziecie niewinnymi.
Sentences_to: He said, "Now also let it be according to your words: he with whom it is found will be my bondservant; and you will be blameless."
Translated_sentences: And he said, So be it, as you speak; but with whom the cup is found, let it be a slave, and you will be innocent.

Sentences_from: Wszystkich synów Faresowych, mieszkających w Jeruzalemie, cztery sta sześćdziesiąt i ośm mężów dużych.
Sentences_to: All the sons of Perez who lived in Jerusalem were four hundred sixty-eight valiant men.
Translated_sentences: All the sons of Fares living in Jerusalem, four hundred and sixty, and eight men great.

Sentences_from: Pieśó Dawidowa. Nie obruszaj się dla złośników, ani zajrzyj czyniącym nieprawość.
Sentences_to: < < By David. > > Don't fret because of evildoers, neither be envious against those who work unrighteousness.
Translated_sentences: Song of David. Do not be moved by the emollies, nor look into those who do iniquity.

Sentences_from: (Przedniejszemu śpiewakowi z synów Korego, na Alamot pieśó.)
Sentences_to: < < For the Chief Musician. By the sons of Korah. According to Alamoth.Alamoth is a musical term. > > God is our refuge and strength, a very present help in trouble.
Translated_sentences: (To the foreman singer of Kore's sons, on Alamot song.)

Sentences_from: Ani strusia, ani sowy, ani wodnej kani, ani krogulca według rodzaju jego.
Sentences_to: you shall surely strike the inhabitants of that city with the edge of the sword, destroying it utterly, and all that is therein and its livestock, with the edge of the sword.
Translated_sentences: Neither ostrich, nor owle, nor water kani, nor sparrowhawk according to his kind.

Sentences_from: Teraz tedy, oto synowie Ammonowi, i Moabowi, i góra Seir, przez którycheś ty nie dopuścił przejść Izraelowi, gdy szli z ziemi Egipskiej, ale ich minęli, a nie wytracili ich.
Sentences_to: Whenever any controversy shall come to you from your brothers who dwell in their cities, between blood and blood, between law and commandment, statutes and ordinances, you shall warn them, that they not be guilty towards Yahweh, and so wrath come on you and on your brothers. Do this, and you shall not be guilty.
Translated_sentences: Now, then, behold the sons of Ammon and Moab and Mount Seir, through whom thou shyed israel from passing as they walked from the land of Egypt, but they passed them by, and did not destroy them.

Sentences_from: Wylij na nich rozgniewanie swoje, a popędliwość gniewu twego niech ich ogarnie.
Sentences_to: Let their habitation be desolate. Let no one dwell in their tents.
Translated_sentences: Pour out your anger on them, and let the impetus of your wrath enveve them.

Sentences_from: Sprawiedliwość twoja sprawiedliwość wieczna, a zakon twój prawda.
Sentences_to: Your righteousness is an everlasting righteousness. Your law is truth.
Translated_sentences: Justice your righteousness is eternal, and the law your truth.

Sentences_from: Blisko jest zginienie Moabowe, i przyjdzie; a nieszczęście jego prędko się pospieszy.
Sentences_to: The calamity of Moab is near to come, and his affliction hurries fast.
Translated_sentences: Moabowe's perishment is near, and he will come; and his misfortune will soon hasten.

Sentences_from: Jakoż mówicie: Mocniśmy, a mężowie duży do boju?
Sentences_to: How do you say, We are mighty men, and valiant men for the war?
Translated_sentences: How do you say: We are strong, and the husbands are big for battle?

Sentences_from: A Jojada spłodził Jonatana, a Jonatan spłodził Jadduę.
Sentences_to: and Joiada became the father of Jonathan, and Jonathan became the father of Jaddua.
Translated_sentences: And Jojada begotten Jonathan, and Jonathan bgotten Jaddua.

Sentences_from: Ale dni moje prędsze były niż poseł; uciekły, a nie widziały nic dobrego.
Sentences_to: "Now my days are swifter than a runner. They flee away, they see no good,
Translated_sentences: But my days were sooner than those of an MP; they ran away and saw nothing good.

Sentences_from: A wziąwszy parę wołów, rozrąbał je na sztuki, i rozesłał po wszystkich granicach Izraelskich przez też posły, mówiąc: Ktokolwiek nie wynijdzie za Saulem i za Samuelem, tak się stanie wołom jego. I padł strach Pański na lud, i wyszli jako mąż jeden.
Sentences_to: He took a yoke of oxen, and cut them in pieces, and sent them throughout all the borders of Israel by the hand of messengers, saying, "Whoever doesn't come forth after Saul and after Samuel, so shall it be done to his oxen." The dread of Yahweh fell on the people, and they came out as one man.
Translated_sentences: And taking a pair of oxen, he cut them into pieces, and sent them over all the borders of Israel through the envoys, saying, Whoever does not follow Saul and Samuel, so shall his oxen. And the Lord's fear fell upon the people, and they went out as a husband one.

Sentences_from: Przytem pojmali dwoje książąt Madyjańskich, Oreba i Zeba; a zabili Oreba na skale Oreb, a Zeba zabili u prasy Zeb, i gonili Madyjanity, a głowę Oreba i Zeba przynieśli do Giedeona za Jordan.
Sentences_to: They took the two princes of Midian, Oreb and Zeeb; and they killed Oreb at the rock of Oreb, and Zeeb they killed at the winepress of Zeeb, and pursued Midian: and they brought the heads of Oreb and Zeeb to Gideon beyond the Jordan.
Translated_sentences: They captured two Madian princes, Oreb and Zeb; and they killed Oreb on the rock of Oreb, and Zeb they killed Zeb at the press, and chased the Midianites, and brought the head of Oreb and Zeb to Geideon behind the Jordan.

Sentences_from: Każdy ostrożny umiejętnie sobie poczyna; ale głupi rozpościera głupstwo.
Sentences_to: Every prudent man acts from knowledge, but a fool exposes folly.
Translated_sentences: Every cautious one skillfully conceives; but the stupid spreads stupidity.

Sentences_from: A za nim poprawiali kapłani, którzy mieszkali w równinie.
Sentences_to: After him, the priests, the men of the Plain made repairs.
Translated_sentences: And behind him corrected the priests who lived in the plain.

Sentences_from: Bo już dwa lata głodu było na ziemi, a jeszcze pięć lat zostaje, których nie będą orać ani żąć.
Sentences_to: For these two years the famine has been in the land, and there are yet five years, in which there will be neither plowing nor harvest.
Translated_sentences: For there have been two years of starvation on earth, and five more years remain, which they will not plough or reassue.

Sentences_from: I był nad Jeftem duch Pański, a przeszedł przez Galaad, i przez Manase; przeszedł też przez Masfa w Galaad, a z Masfy w Galaad ciągnął przeciw synom Ammonowym.
Sentences_to: Then the Spirit of Yahweh came on Jephthah, and he passed over Gilead and Manasseh, and passed over Mizpeh of Gilead, and from Mizpeh of Gilead he passed over to the children of Ammon.
Translated_sentences: And the spirit of the Lord was over Jephthah, and it passed through Galaad and through Manase; he also passed through Masfa at Galaad, and from Masfa at Galaad he pulled against the sons of Ammon.

Sentences_from: Panu pożycza, kto ma litość nad ubogim, a on mu za dobrodziejstwo jego odda.
Sentences_to: He who has pity on the poor lends to Yahweh; he will reward him.
Translated_sentences: He lends to the Lord whoever has mercy on the poor, and he will give him for his benefit.

Sentences_from: Izali wytrzyma serce twoje? izali zdołają ręce twoje dniom, których Ja z tobą będę miał sprawę? Ja Pan rzekłem, i uczynię.
Sentences_to: Can your heart endure, or can your hands be strong, in the days that I shall deal with you? I, Yahweh, have spoken it, and will do it.
Translated_sentences: Will Izali endure your heart? Will they be able to give your hands to the days that I will have with you? I have said the Lord, and I will do.

Sentences_from: Rozprzestrzeó miejsce namiotu swego, a opon przybytków swych nie zabraniaj rozciągnąć: wyciągnij powrozy twoje, a kołki twoje utwierdź.
Sentences_to: "Enlarge the place of your tent, and let them stretch forth the curtains of your habitations; don't spare: lengthen your cords, and strengthen your stakes.
Translated_sentences: He will scatter the place of his tent, and do not forbid the tires of his tabernacles to be stretched: pull out your cords, and make your pegs.

Sentences_from: Dla głosu tego, który mię sromoci i potwarza, dla nieprzyjaciela, i tego, który się mści.
Sentences_to: All this has come on us, yet have we not forgotten you, Neither have we been false to your covenant.
Translated_sentences: For the voice of the one who sromocs and slanders me, for the enemy, and for the one who is taking revenge.

Sentences_from: Zbudowałaś sobie dom nierządny, i wystawiłaś sobie wyżynę w każdej ulicy.
Sentences_to: that you have built for yourselves a vaulted place, and have made yourselves a lofty place in every street.
Translated_sentences: You have built yourself a house of fornication, and you have erected a highland in every street.

Sentences_from: A posławszy Joab posły do Dawida, rzekł: Walczyłem przeciw Rabbie i wziąłam miasto wód.
Sentences_to: Joab sent messengers to David, and said, "I have fought against Rabbah. Yes, I have taken the city of waters.
Translated_sentences: And after sending Joab an envoy to David, he said, I fought against Rabbie, and I took the city of waters.

Sentences_from: Wspominałem sobie na śpiewanie moje; w nocym w sercu swem rozmyślał, i wywiadywał się o tem duch mój, mówiąc:
Sentences_to: "Will the Lord reject us forever? Will he be favorable no more?
Translated_sentences: I remembered my singing; at night in his heart he meditated and interviewed my spirit, saying:

Sentences_from: To usłyszawszy Syon rozweseli się, a radować się będą córki Judzkie, dla sądów twoich, Panie!
Sentences_to: Zion heard and was glad. The daughters of Judah rejoiced, because of your judgments, Yahweh.
Translated_sentences: Upon hearing this, Syon will rejoice, and the daughters of Judah shall rejoice for your judgments, O Lord!

Sentences_from: Bo długość komórek, które były w sieni zewnętrzej, była na pięćdziesiąt łokci, a przed kościołem sto łokci.
Sentences_to: For the length of the rooms that were in the outer court was fifty cubits: and behold, before the temple were one hundred cubits.
Translated_sentences: Because the length of the cells that were in the outer hallway was fifty cubits, and in front of the church a hundred cubits.

Sentences_from: Synowie zaś Merarego według domów swych: Naheli i Muzy; te są familije Lewiego według domów ojców ich.
Sentences_to: The sons of Merari by their families: Mahli and Mushi. These are the families of the Levites according to their fathers' houses.
Translated_sentences: And the sons of Merary according to their homes: Naheli and muse; these are levi's familije according to the homes of their fathers.

Sentences_from: Gdyż i ciemności nic nie zakryją przed tobą; owszem tobie noc jako dzień świeci; ciemnościć są jako światłość.
Sentences_to: even the darkness doesn't hide from you, but the night shines as the day. The darkness is like light to you.
Translated_sentences: For the darkness will not hide anything from you; yes, night shines on you as day; darkness is as light.

Sentences_from: Ćwicz młodego według potrzeby drogi jego; bo gdy się zstarzeje, nie odstąpi od niej.
Sentences_to: Train up a child in the way he should go, and when he is old he will not depart from it.
Translated_sentences: Practice the young according to the need of his way; because when he gets old, he will not deviate from it.

Sentences_from: Gdy omyje Pan plugastwo córek Syońskich, a krew Jeruzalemską opłócze z niego w duchu sądu, i w duchu zapalenia.
Sentences_to: when the Lord shall have washed away the filth of the daughters of Zion, and shall have purged the blood of Jerusalem from its midst, by the spirit of justice, and by the spirit of burning.
Translated_sentences: When the Lord washes away the filth of the daughters of Zion, and the blood of Jerusalem, he sprinkles from him in the spirit of judgment and in the spirit of inflammation.

Sentences_from: A ołtarz na dwanaście łokci wdłuż, a na dwanaście wszerz czworograniasty po czterech stronach swoich;
Sentences_to: The altar hearth shall be twelve [cubits] long by twelve broad, square in the four sides of it.
Translated_sentences: And the altar on twelve cubits extend, and twelve quadruped on four sides of its own;

Sentences_from: Rozweselże nas według dni, którycheś nas utrapił, według lat, którycheśmy doznali złego.
Sentences_to: Make us glad for as many days as you have afflicted us, for as many years as we have seen evil.
Translated_sentences: He will cheer us up according to the days you have affliction to us, according to the years we have suffered evil.

Sentences_from: Wiedzcież, żeć Pan odłączył sobie pobożnego; wysłucha Pan, gdy zawołam do niego.
Sentences_to: Stand in awe, and don't sin. Search your own heart on your bed, and be still. Selah.
Translated_sentences: Know that the Lord has separated the pious one; you will listen when I call him.

Sentences_from: A wezbrawszy się z synowemi swemi wróciła się z ziemi Moabskiej; bo słyszała w krainie Moabskiej, że był nawiedził Pan lud swój, i dał im chleb.
Sentences_to: Then she arose with her daughters-in-law, that she might return from the country of Moab: for she had heard in the country of Moab how that Yahweh had visited his people in giving them bread.
Translated_sentences: And having scurred with her daughters-in-law, she returned from the land of Moab; for she had heard in the land of Moab that the Lord had visited his people, and had given them bread.

Sentences_from: A gdy usłyszał Aza te słowa, i proroctwo Obeda proroka, zmocnił się, i zniósł obrzydliwości ze wszystkiej ziemi Judzkiej i Benjamińskiej, i z miast, które był pobrał na górze Efraim, i odnowił ołtarz Pański, który był przed przysionkiem Pańskim.
Sentences_to: Asa had an army that bore bucklers and spears, out of Judah three hundred thousand; and out of Benjamin, that bore shields and drew bows, two hundred eighty thousand: all these were mighty men of valor.
Translated_sentences: And when Aza heard these words, and the prophecy of Obed the prophet, he became stronger, and endured the abominations of all the lands of Judah and Benyamen, and of the cities which he was taken on Mount Ephraim, and restored the altar of the Lord, which was before the tabernale of the Lord.

Sentences_from: Pan pokornych podnosi; ale niepobożnych aż ku ziemi uniża.
Sentences_to: Yahweh upholds the humble. He brings the wicked down to the ground.
Translated_sentences: The Lord of the humble lifts up; but he humbles the ungodly to the ground.

Sentences_from: Popędliwość jego porwała mię, i wziął nienawiść przeciwko mnie; a zgrzytając na mię zębami swemi, jako nieprzyjaciel mój, bystremi oczyma swemi spojrzał na mię.
Sentences_to: He has torn me in his wrath, and persecuted me. He has gnashed on me with his teeth. My adversary sharpens his eyes on me.
Translated_sentences: His impetuosity swept me away, and he took hatred against me; and chrusting his teeth at me, as my enemy, he looked at me with his keen eyes.

Sentences_from: I odwrócił się od niego ku drugiemu, i pytał się jako i przedtem; a odpowiedział mu lud tak jako i pierwej.
Sentences_to: He turned away from him toward another, and spoke like that again; and the people answered him again the same way.
Translated_sentences: And he turned away from him to the other, and asked as and before; and the people answered him as before.

Sentences_from: Żadnej roboty nie będziecie czynili w ten dzień; bo dzień oczyszczania jest na oczyszczenie was przed obliczem Pana, Boga waszego.
Sentences_to: Whether it is a cow or ewe, you shall not kill it and its young both in one day.
Translated_sentences: You will not do any work on this day; for the day of purification is to purify you before the Lord your God.

Sentences_from: Ale Danijel prosił króla, aby przełożył nad sprawami krainy Babilońskiej Sadracha, Mesacha i Abednego; a Danijel bywał w bramie królewskiej.
Sentences_to: Daniel requested of the king, and he appointed Shadrach, Meshach, and Abednego, over the affairs of the province of Babylon: but Daniel was in the gate of the king.
Translated_sentences: But Danijel asked the king to translate Sadrach, Mesach, and Abednego over the affairs of the Babylonian land; and Danijel used to be at the royal gate.

Sentences_from: Pilnuj mię Panie! a słuchaj głosu tych, którzy się spierają ze mną.
Sentences_to: Give heed to me, Yahweh, and listen to the voice of those who contend with me.
Translated_sentences: Watch over me, Lord! and listen to the voice of those who argue with me.

Sentences_from: I rzekłem: Ach, ach panujący Panie! Oto nie umiem mówić, bom jest dziecięciem.
Sentences_to: Then I said, "Ah, Lord Yahweh! Behold, I don't know how to speak; for I am a child."
Translated_sentences: And I said, Ae, oh reigning Lord! Behold, I can't speak, bom is a child.

Sentences_from: Od Pana zastępów nawiedzione będzie gromem i trzęsieniem ziemi, i głosem wielkim, wichrem i burzą, i płomieniem ognia pożerającego.
Sentences_to: She will be visited by Yahweh of Armies with thunder, with earthquake, with great noise, with whirlwind and storm, and with the flame of a devouring fire.
Translated_sentences: From the Lord of hosts it will be visited by thunder and earthquake and great voice, whirling and storming, and flame of devouring fire.

Sentences_from: Przeniesie się urodzaj domu jego; dobra jego rozpłyną się w dzień gniewu jego.
Sentences_to: The increase of his house shall depart. They shall rush away in the day of his wrath.
Translated_sentences: The harvest of his house will be moved; his goods will dissolve in the day of his wrath.

Sentences_from: Albowiem ruszyła się chorągiew obozu synów Judowych naprzód z hufcami swemi, a nad wojskiem jego był hetman Naason, syn Aminadabów.
Sentences_to: First, the standard of the camp of the children of Judah went forward according to their armies. Nahshon the son of Amminadab was over his army.
Translated_sentences: For the banner of the camp of the sons of Judah moved forward with their troops, and above his army was Hetman Naason, the son of the Aminadabs.

Sentences_from: Komory też bramy ku drodze wschodniej były trzy z jednej a trzy z drugiej strony; jednaka miara była wszystkich trzech, jednaka też miara podwoi ich z obu stron.
Sentences_to: The lodges of the gate eastward were three on this side, and three on that side; they three were of one measure: and the posts had one measure on this side and on that side.
Translated_sentences: The chambers of the gate to the eastern road were three on one side and three on the other; the same measure was all three, but the measure will double them on both sides.

Sentences_from: Miasta twoje w spustoszenie obrócę, że będziesz spustoszona, i dowiesz się, żem Ja Pan.
Sentences_to: I will lay your cities waste, and you shall be desolate; and you shall know that I am Yahweh.
Translated_sentences: I will turn your cities into desolation, that you will be devastated, and you will know that I am the Lord.

Sentences_from: I zgromadził wszystkich książąt Izraelskich, i kapłanów, i Lewitów;
Sentences_to: He gathered together all the princes of Israel, with the priests and the Levites.
Translated_sentences: And he gathered all the princes of Israel, and the priests, and the Levites;

Sentences_from: Miesiąca ósmego roku wtórego Daryjusza stało się słowo Pańskie do mnie Zacharyjasza, syna Barachyjaszowego, syna Iddowego, proroka, mówiąc:
Sentences_to: In the eighth month, in the second year of Darius, the word of Yahweh came to Zechariah the son of Berechiah, the son of Iddo, the prophet, saying,
Translated_sentences: In the eighth month of the Second Year of Dariyus the word of the Lord became to me Zachariyah, son of Barachiash, son of Idd, prophet, saying:

Sentences_from: Choć synowie Jonadaba, syna Rechabowego, dosyć uczynili rozkazaniu ojca swego, które im przykazał, ale ten lud nie jest mi posłuszny.
Sentences_to: Because the sons of Jonadab the son of Rechab have performed the commandment of their father which he commanded them, but this people has not listened to me;
Translated_sentences: Though the sons of Jonadab, the son of Reho rehound, have done enough of the command of their father which he commanded them, but this people do not obey me.

Sentences_from: Był mąż w ziemi Uz, imieniem Ijob; a ten mąż był doskonały, i szczery, i bojący się Boga, a odstępujący od złego.
Sentences_to: There was a man in the land of Uz, whose name was Job. That man was blameless and upright, and one who feared God , and turned away from evil.
Translated_sentences: There was a husband in the land of Uz, named Job; and this man was perfect, and sincere, and afraid of God, and apostate from evil.

Sentences_from: I stanęli w pośród onego pola, i obronili go, a porazili Filistynów: i wybawił Pan lud wybawieniem wielkiem.
Sentences_to: They stood in the midst of the plot, and defended it, and killed the Philistines; and Yahweh saved them by a great victory.
Translated_sentences: And they stood in the midst of that field, and they defended it, and they offended the Philistines: and the Lord delivered the people with a great deliverance.

Sentences_from: Pan mię wybawił; przetoż pieśó moję śpiewać będziemy po wszystkie dni żywota naszego w domu Pańskim.
Sentences_to: Yahweh will save me. Therefore we will sing my songs with stringed instruments all the days of our life in the house of Yahweh.
Translated_sentences: The Lord has saved me; therefore we will sing my song all the days of our life in the house of the Lord.

Sentences_from: Nie ofiarujcież więcej ofiary daremnej. Kadzenie jest mi obrzydłością; nowiu miesiąca i sabatu, gdy zwoływacie zgromadzenia, nie mogę ścierpieć (bo nieprawością jest) ani dnia zapowiedzianego.
Sentences_to: Bring no more vain offerings. Incense is an abomination to me; new moons, Sabbaths, and convocations: I can't bear with evil assemblies.
Translated_sentences: Offer no more futile sacrifice. Incense is an abomination to me; The new moon of the month and the Sabbath, when you convene assemblies, I cannot bear (for it is iniquity) nor the day foretold.

Sentences_from: A do Gada rzekł: Błogosławiony, który rozmnaża Gada! jako lew mieszkać będzie, a porwie ramię i głowę;
Sentences_to: Of Gad he said, "He who enlarges Gad is blessed. He dwells as a lioness, and tears the arm, yes, the crown of the head.
Translated_sentences: And to the Reptile he said, Blessed is he who reproduces the Reptile! as a lion he will dwell, and he will kidnap his arm and head;

Sentences_from: A ktobykolwiek nie szukał Pana, Boga Izraelskiego, aby był zabity, od najmniejszego aż do największego, od męża aż do niewiast.
Sentences_to: Asa and the people who were with him pursued them to Gerar: and there fell of the Ethiopians so many that they could not recover themselves; for they were destroyed before Yahweh, and before his army; and they carried away very much booty.
Translated_sentences: And whoever did not seek the Lord, the God of Israel, to be killed, from the smallest to the greatest, from the husband to the woman.

Sentences_from: Bo was wyzwolę od wszystkich nieczystót waszych, i przywołam zboża, i rozmnożę je, a nie dopuszczę na was głodu.
Sentences_to: I will save you from all your uncleanness: and I will call for the grain, and will multiply it, and lay no famine on you.
Translated_sentences: For I will deliver you from all your impurities, and I will call up the grains, and I will multiply them, and I will not allow you to starve.

Sentences_from: Manases Efraima, a Efraim Manasesa, a obaj społu będą przeciwko Judzie. Wszakże w tem wszystkiem nie odwróci się zapalczywość jego; ale jeszcze ręka jego będzie wyciągniona.
Sentences_to: One will devour on the right hand, and be hungry; and he will eat on the left hand, and they will not be satisfied. Everyone will eat the flesh of his own arm:
Translated_sentences: Manases of Ephraim and Ephraim of Manases, and both will be against Judah. After all, in all this his fierceness will not be reversed; but his hand will still be stretched out.

Sentences_from: I stało się słowo Boże do Semejasza, męża Bożego, mówiąc:
Sentences_to: But the word of God came to Shemaiah the man of God, saying,
Translated_sentences: And the word of God was made to Shemeias, the man of God, saying:

Sentences_from: Napełnił je mądrością serca, aby robili wszelakie rzemiosło ciesielskie, i haftarskie, i tkackie z hijacyntu, i z szarłatu, z karmazynu dwa kroć farbowanego, i z białego jedwabiu tkacką robotą, aby robili każdą robotę dowcipnie wymyślając.
Sentences_to: He has filled them with wisdom of heart, to work all kinds of workmanship, of the engraver, of the skillful workman, and of the embroiderer, in blue, in purple, in scarlet, and in fine linen, and of the weaver, even of those who do any workmanship, and of those who make skillful works.
Translated_sentences: He filled them with the wisdom of his heart to make all kinds of carpentry crafts, and embroidery, and weaving from hyjacynt, and from amaranth, from crimson two slices of dyed, and from white silk with weaving work, so that they would do every job wittily inventing.

Sentences_from: Wnieśli tedy kapłani skrzynię przymierza Pańskiego na miejsce jej, do wnętrznego domu, to jest do świątnicy najświętszej pod skrzydła Cherubinów;
Sentences_to: The priests brought in the ark of the covenant of Yahweh to its place, into the oracle of the house, to the most holy place, even under the wings of the cherubim.
Translated_sentences: The priests, therefore, brought the chest of the Lord's covenant into its place, into the interior house, that is, into the most holy feast under the wings of the Cherubim;

Sentences_from: A poznają Egipczanie, żem Ja Pan, gdy wyciągnę rękę moję na Egipt, i wywiodę syny Izraelskie z pośrodku ich.
Sentences_to: The Egyptians shall know that I am Yahweh, when I stretch out my hand on Egypt, and bring out the children of Israel from among them."
Translated_sentences: And the Egyptians will know that I the Lord, when I stretch out my hand upon Egypt, and I will draw the sons of Israel out of their midst.

Sentences_from: Widzenie srogie jest mi okazane. Przewrotny przewrotność broi, a pustoszyciel pustoszy. Przyciągnijże, Elamie! Oblęż, Medzie! Babilon; wszelkiemu wzdychaniu jego koniec uczynię.
Sentences_to: A grievous vision is declared to me. The treacherous man deals treacherously, and the destroyer destroys. Go up, Elam; attack! I have stopped all of Media's sighing.
Translated_sentences: Severe vision is shown to me. The perverse perversity of the brooch, and the desolator ravages. Attract, Elami! Siege, Med! Babylon; to all sighing I will make its end.

Sentences_from: Także dla rozkosznych owoców ziemi, i obfitości jej, a dla życzliwości mieszkającego w krzu. Niech to błogosławieństwo przyjdzie na głowę Józefowę, i na wierzch głowy Nazarejczyka między bracią jego.
Sentences_to: for the precious things of the earth and its fullness, the good will of him who lived in the bush . Let this come on the head of Joseph, on the crown of the head of him who was separate from his brothers.
Translated_sentences: Also for the delightful fruits of the earth, and the abundance of it, and for the kindness of the one who dwells in the floe. May this blessing come upon the head of Josephine, and upon the top of the head of the Nazarene among his brethren.

Sentences_from: (I usłyszeli synowie Benjamin, iż się zebrali synowie Izraelscy w Masfa.) Rzekli tedy synowie Izraelscy: Powiedzcie, jako się stał ten zły uczynek?
Sentences_to: (Now the children of Benjamin heard that the children of Israel had gone up to Mizpah.) The children of Israel said, "Tell us, how did this wickedness happen?"
Translated_sentences: (And benjamin's sons heard that the sons of Israel had gathered at Masfa.) So said the sons of Israel, Tell me, How has this evil deed been done?

Sentences_from: Pierwiastki pierwszych urodzajów ziemi twej przyniesiesz w dom Pana Boga twego. Nie będziesz warzył koźlęcia w mleku matki jego.
Sentences_to: "You shall bring the first of the first fruits of your ground to the house of Yahweh your God. "You shall not boil a young goat in its mother's milk."
Translated_sentences: You will bring the elements of the first kinds of your land into the house of the Lord thy God. You shall not brew a kid in his mother's milk.

Sentences_from: I niesli synowie Lewitów skrzynię Bożą, jako był rozkazał Mojżesz według słowa Pańskiego, na ramionach swych, na drążkach które przy niej były.
Sentences_to: The children of the Levites bore the ark of God on their shoulders with the poles thereon, as Moses commanded according to the word of Yahweh.
Translated_sentences: And the notable sons of the Levites commanded the chest of God, as moses commanded according to the word of the Lord, on his arms, on the rods which were with her.

Sentences_from: Kiedy ich był mały poczet, prawie mały poczet, a jeszcze w niej byli przychodniami.
Sentences_to: when they were but a few men in number, yes, very few, and foreigners in it.
Translated_sentences: When there was a small post of them, almost a small post, and still in it they were clinics.

Sentences_from: Jedno Panu nie bądźcie odpornymi, ani się wy bójcie ludu onej ziemi, bo jako chleb pojeść je możemy; odstąpiła obrona ich od nich, ale Pan jest z nami; nie bójcież się ich.
Sentences_to: Only don't rebel against Yahweh, neither fear the people of the land; for they are bread for us: their defense is removed from over them, and Yahweh is with us. Don't fear them."
Translated_sentences: Do not be immune to the Lord, nor do you fight against the people of this earth, for we can eat it as bread; they have been adjoined to defend them, but the Lord is with us; do not be afraid of them.

Sentences_from: Wystawisz tedy przybytek na ten kształt, któryć ukazano na górze.
Sentences_to: You shall set up the tabernacle according to the way that it was shown to you on the mountain.
Translated_sentences: You will then expose the tabernacle to the shape shown above.

Sentences_from: I stał się wieczór, i stał się zaranek, dzień czwarty.
Sentences_to: There was evening and there was morning, a fourth day.
Translated_sentences: And it became evening, and it became morning, the fourth day.

Sentences_from: Spojrzyjcie na narody a obaczcie i dziwujcie się z zdumieniem, przeto, iż czynię nieco za dni waszych, o czem gdy wam powiadać będą, nie uwierzycie.
Sentences_to: "Look among the nations, watch, and wonder marvelously; for I am working a work in your days, which you will not believe though it is told you.
Translated_sentences: Look upon the nations, and be astonished and wonder, therefore, that I am doing a little in your days, of which when they tell you, you will not believe.

Sentences_from: Tylko niech nie chowa wiele koni, ani nawraca ludu do Egiptu, aby wiele koni nabył, ponieważ wam Pan rzekł: Nie wracajcie się zaś tą drogą więcej.
Sentences_to: Three times in a year shall all your males appear before Yahweh your God in the place which he shall choose: in the feast of unleavened bread, and in the feast of weeks, and in the feast of tents; and they shall not appear before Yahweh empty:
Translated_sentences: But let him not hide many horses, nor convert the people to Egypt, that he may acquire many horses, for the Lord has said to you, "Do not return in this way any more."

Sentences_from: I będzie kapłan ofiarował jedno za grzech, a drugie na ofiarę całopalenia, i oczyści go od tego, czem zgrzeszył nad umarłym, a poświęci głowę jego dnia onego.
Sentences_to: The priest shall offer one for a sin offering, and the other for a burnt offering, and make atonement for him, because he sinned by reason of the dead, and shall make his head holy that same day.
Translated_sentences: And the priest will offer one for sin and the other for the sacrifice of burnt offering, and cleanse him from what he has sinned over the dead, and he will consecrate his head on his day.

Sentences_from: I dał imię pierwszej Jemina, a imię drugiej Kietzyja, a imię trzeciej Kierenhappuch.
Sentences_to: He called the name of the first, Jemimah; and the name of the second, Keziah; and the name of the third, Keren Happuch.
Translated_sentences: And he gave the name of the first Jemin, and the name of the second Kietzyja, and the name of the third Kierenhappuch.

Sentences_from: A Sedechyjasz, syn Chanaanowy, sprawił sobie rogi żelazne, i rzekł: Tak mówi Pan: Temi będziesz bódł Syryjczyków, aż ich wyniszczysz.
Sentences_to: The fear of Yahweh fell on all the kingdoms of the lands that were around Judah, so that they made no war against Jehoshaphat.
Translated_sentences: And Sedechiah, the son of Canaan, made himself iron horns, and said, Thus saith the Lord, Theee shall thou shy unto the Syrians until thou shy thou shy thou shies.

Sentences_from: Z nozdrzy jego wychodzi dym, jako z garnca wrzącego, albo kotła.
Sentences_to: "I will not keep silence concerning his limbs, nor his mighty strength, nor his goodly frame.
Translated_sentences: Smoke comes out of his nostrils, as from a boiling pot or cauldron.

Sentences_from: A powiedz ziemi Izraelskiej: Tak mówi panujący Pan: Otom Ja przeciwko tobie, i dobędę miecza mego z pochew jego, i wytnę z ciebie sprawiedliwego i niezbożnego.
Sentences_to: The word of Yahweh came to me, saying,
Translated_sentences: And say to the land of Israel, Thus saith the reigning Lord, I am against you, and I will take my sword out of his sheath, and I will cut out of you the just and the ungodly.

Sentences_from: Tedy rzekł Michas: Teraz wiem, że mi będzie Pan błogosławił, gdyż mam Lewitę za kapłana.
Sentences_to: Then Micah said, "Now know I that Yahweh will do good to me, since I have a Levite to my priest."
Translated_sentences: Then Michas said, Now I know that the Lord will bless me, for I have the Levite as a priest.

Sentences_from: Widział też Jakób twarz Labanową, a oto, nie był takim przeciwko niemu, jako przedtem.
Sentences_to: Jacob saw the expression on Laban's face, and, behold, it was not toward him as before.
Translated_sentences: Jacob also saw the face of Laban, and behold, he was not so against him as before.

Sentences_from: A jeźliby lud ziemi nie dbając przeglądał mężowi takiemu, który by ofiarował Molochowi potomstwo swe, i nie zabiłby go:
Sentences_to: "'Don't turn to idols, nor make molten gods for yourselves. I am Yahweh your God.
Translated_sentences: And if the people of the earth did not care, they looked at a man who would offer his offspring to Moloch, and would not kill him:

Sentences_from: Jako jeść wiele miodu nie jest rzecz dobra: tak szukanie własnej sławy jest niesławne.
Sentences_to: It is not good to eat much honey; nor is it honorable to seek one's own honor.
Translated_sentences: As to eat a lot of honey is not a good thing: so seeking your own fame is infamous.

Sentences_from: Z przykazaó twoich nabyłem rozumu: przetoż mam w nienawiści wszelką ścieszkę obłędliwą.
Sentences_to: Through your precepts, I get understanding; therefore I hate every false way.
Translated_sentences: From your commandments I have acquired reason: therefore I hate every insane path.

Sentences_from: Pan jest Bóg zapalczywy i mściwy; mściwy jest Pan a gniewliwy; Pan, który się mści nad przeciwnikami swymi, i chowa gniew przeciwko nieprzyjaciołom swoim.
Sentences_to: Yahweh is a jealous God and avenges. Yahweh avenges and is full of wrath. Yahweh takes vengeance on his adversaries, and he maintains wrath against his enemies.
Translated_sentences: The Lord is a fierce and vindous God; the Lord is vindous and the angry; The Lord who take revenge on his adversaries and hides his wrath against his enemies.

Sentences_from: I upadł Joab obliczem swem na ziemię, a pokłoniwszy się błogosławił królowi, i rzekł Joab: Dziś poznał sługa twój, żem znalazł łaskę w oczach twoich, królu, panie mój, ponieważ uczynił król zadość prośbie sługi swego.
Sentences_to: Joab fell to the ground on his face, showed respect, and blessed the king. Joab said, "Today your servant knows that I have found favor in your sight, my lord, king, in that the king has performed the request of his servant."
Translated_sentences: And Joab fell to the ground with his face, and after bowing down he blessed himself to the king, and joab said, Today your servant has known that I have found favor in your eyes, king, my lord, because he has made the king atonish the request of his servant.

Sentences_from: Zwierciadła, i rantuszki, i tkanki, i letniki.
Sentences_to: the hand mirrors, the fine linen garments, the tiaras, and the shawls.
Translated_sentences: Mirrors, and rantusks, and tissues, and summer residents.

Sentences_from: I wszedłszy Aod do niego, (a on sam siedział na sali letniej, którą miał sam dla siebie,)i rzekł Aod: Mam rozkazanie Boże do ciebie. I powstał z stolicy swojej.
Sentences_to: Ehud came to him; and he was sitting by himself alone in the cool upper room. Ehud said, "I have a message from God to you." He arose out of his seat.
Translated_sentences: And when Aod came into him (and he himself was sitting in the summer room, which he had for himself,) and said Aod, I have God's command to you. And he arose from his capital.

Sentences_from: A było dni Izaakowych sto lat, i osiemdziesiąt lat.
Sentences_to: The days of Isaac were one hundred eighty years.
Translated_sentences: And there were Isaac days one hundred years, and eighty years.

Sentences_from: Wszedł tedy Naaman, i oznajmił to panu swemu, mówiąc: Tak a tak mówiła dzieweczka, która jest z ziemi Izraelskiej.
Sentences_to: Someone went in, and told his lord, saying, "The maiden who is from the land of Israel said this."
Translated_sentences: So Naaman came in and told his master, saying, So and so said the little girl who is of the land of Israel.

Sentences_from: (Przedniejszemu śpiewakowi na Machalat pieśó Dawidowa nauczająca.)
Sentences_to: < < For the Chief Musician. To the tune of "Mahalath." A contemplation by David. > > The fool has said in his heart, "There is no God." They are corrupt, and have done abominable iniquity. There is no one who does good.
Translated_sentences: (To the foreman singer on the Machalat song of David teaching.)

Sentences_from: Przed grzmotem jeźdźców i strzelających z łuku uciecze wszystko miasto; wejdą do gęstych obłoków, i na skały wstąpią. Wszystkie miasta opuszczone będą, a nie będzie, ktoby w nich mieszkał.
Sentences_to: Every city flees for the noise of the horsemen and archers; they go into the thickets, and climb up on the rocks: every city is forsaken, and not a man dwells therein.
Translated_sentences: From the thunder of riders and archers, everything in the city will escape; they will enter the dense clouds, and they will ascend the rocks. All cities will be abandoned, and there will be no one to live in them.

Sentences_from: Nie został nikt z Enakitów, w ziemi synów Izraelskich; tylko w Gazie, w Gad, i w Azdod zostali.
Sentences_to: There were none of the Anakim left in the land of the children of Israel. Only in Gaza, in Gath, and in Ashdod, did some remain.
Translated_sentences: None of the Enakits remained in the land of the sons of Israel; only in Gaza, in Gad, and in Azdod they stayed.

Sentences_from: I położę znak odkupienia między ludem moim i między ludem twoim; jutro będzie znak ten.
Sentences_to: Then the magicians said to Pharaoh, "This is the finger of God:" and Pharaoh's heart was hardened, and he didn't listen to them; as Yahweh had spoken.
Translated_sentences: And I will lay the sign of redemption among my people and among your people; tomorrow there will be this sign.

Sentences_from: A jeźliż jest nieczysta ziemia osiadłości waszej, przeprowadźcie się do ziemi dziedzictwa Pańskiego, w której przebywa przybytek Pański, i weźmiecie osiadłości w pośrodku nas; tylko Panu nie bądźcie odpornymi, a nie odpadajcie od nas, budując sobie ołtarz oprócz ołtarza Pana, Boga naszego.
Sentences_to: However, if the land of your possession is unclean, then pass over to the land of the possession of Yahweh, in which Yahweh's tabernacle dwells, and take possession among us; but don't rebel against Yahweh, nor rebel against us, in building an altar other than the altar of Yahweh our God.
Translated_sentences: And if there is an unclean land of your settlation, move to the land of the Lord's inheritance, in which the tabernacle of the Lord dwells, and take a settling place in the midst of us; only to the Lord do not be resilient, and do not fall away from us, building for yourselves an altar in addition to the altar of the Lord our God.

Sentences_from: I rzekli do Jeremijasza proroka:Niech przyjdzie proszę prośba nasza przed oblicze twoje, a módl się za nami Panu, Bogu twemu, za wszystek ten ostatek; bo nas mało zostało z wielu, jako to widzisz oczyma twemi;
Sentences_to: and said to Jeremiah the prophet, Please let our supplication be presented before you, and pray for us to Yahweh your God, even for all this remnant; for we are left but a few of many, as your eyes do see us:
Translated_sentences: And they said to Jeremiah the prophet, "Let our petition come before thy face, and pray for us, lord thy God, for all this remnant; for we are few left of many, as you see it with your eyes;

Sentences_from: Synów Elamowych tysiąc dwieście pięćdziesiąt i cztery;
Sentences_to: The children of Elam, one thousand two hundred fifty-four.
Translated_sentences: The Sons of Elam one thousand two hundred and fifty and four;

Sentences_from: Wymierzył też mur domu na sześć łokci, a szerokość komory na cztery łokcie wszędy około domu.
Sentences_to: Then he measured the wall of the house, six cubits; and the breadth of every side room, four cubits, all around the house on every side.
Translated_sentences: He also divided the wall of the house at six cubits, and the width of the chamber at four cubits around the house.

Sentences_from: Ponieważ od króla i od siedmiu radnych panów jego jesteś posłany, abyś dojrzał Judy i Jeruzalemu według zakonu Boga twego, który jest w rękach twoich.
Sentences_to: Because you are sent of the king and his seven counselors, to inquire concerning Judah and Jerusalem, according to the law of your God which is in your hand,
Translated_sentences: For from the king and from the seven councilors of his lords you are sent that you may mature Judah and Jerusalem according to the law of your God, which is in your hands.

Sentences_from: Ona tedy przybiwszy gwoździem do wału tkackiego rzekła do niego: Filistynowie nad tobą, Samsonie; ale on ocuciwszy się ze snu swego, wyrwał gwóźdź z osnową i z wałem.
Sentences_to: She fastened it with the pin, and said to him, "The Philistines are on you, Samson!" He awakened out of his sleep, and plucked away the pin of the beam, and the web.
Translated_sentences: And she nailed to the weaving rampart and said to him, Philistines over you, Samson; but he, having awakened himself from his sleep, snatched a nail with a dontail and a rampart.

Sentences_from: A niech postanowi król starostów po wszystkich krainach królestwa swego, którzyby zebrali wszystkie dzieweczki, panienki pięknej urody, do Susan miasta stołecznego, do domu białych głów, pod dozór Hegaja, komornika królewskiego, stróża białych głó w, a dali im ochędostwa ich.
Sentences_to: Let the king appoint officers in all the provinces of his kingdom, that they may gather together all the beautiful young virgins to the citadel of Susa, to the women's house, to the custody of Hegai the king's eunuch, keeper of the women. Let cosmetics be given them;
Translated_sentences: And let the king of the governors of all the lands of his kingdom decide, who should gather all the girls, the maidens of beautiful beauty, to Susan of the capital city, to the house of the white heads, under the supervision of Hegaja, the royal bailiff, the guardian of the white guards, and give them their waning.

Sentences_from: Spustoszenie w mieście zostanie, a bramy zburzone będą.
Sentences_to: The city is left in desolation, and the gate is struck with destruction.
Translated_sentences: The devastation in the city will remain, and the gates will be demolished.

Sentences_from: Tedy Abimelech rzekł do Abrahama: Na cóż to siedmioro owiec, któreś postawił osobno?
Sentences_to: Abimelech said to Abraham, "What do these seven ewe lambs which you have set by themselves mean?"
Translated_sentences: Then Abimelech said to Abraham, "What are these seven sheep that you have placed separately?

Sentences_from: Teć są domy Lewi: dom Libnitów, dom Hebronitów, dom Moholitów, dom Musytów, dom Korytów; a Kaat spłodził Amrama.
Sentences_to: These are the families of Levi: the family of the Libnites, the family of the Hebronites, the family of the Mahlites, the family of the Mushites, the family of the Korahites. Kohath became the father of Amram.
Translated_sentences: Teć are the houses of Levi: the house of the Libnites, the house of the Hebronites, the house of the Moholites, the house of the Mussites, the house of the Corinths; and Kaat bgotten Amram.

Sentences_from: A tak poczęła niewiasta, i porodziła syna o onymże czasie po roku, jako jej był powiedział Elizeusz.
Sentences_to: The woman conceived, and bore a son at that season, when the time came around, as Elisha had said to her.
Translated_sentences: And so the woman conceived, and gave birth to a son at that time after a year, as her was said Elisha.

Sentences_from: Przetoż oto przychodzą dni, mówi Pan, których nie rzeką więcej: Jako żyje Pan, który wywiódł synów Izraelskich z ziemi Egipskiej.
Sentences_to: Therefore behold, the days come, says Yahweh, that they shall no more say, As Yahweh lives, who brought up the children of Israel out of the land of Egypt;
Translated_sentences: Therefore the days come, saith the Lord, which no longer the river: As the Lord who brought the children of Israel out of the land of Egypt lives.

Sentences_from: I rozkazałem Baruchowi przed oczyma ich, mówiąc:
Sentences_to: I commanded Baruch before them, saying,
Translated_sentences: And I commanded Baruch before their eyes, saying:

Sentences_from: Także we wszystkich sprawach ręki możnej, i we wszystkich postrachach wielkich, które czynił Mojżesz przed oczyma wszystkiego Izraela.
Sentences_to: Yahweh alone led him. There was no foreign god with him.
Translated_sentences: Also in all matters of the mighty hand, and in all the great terrors that Moses did before the eyes of all Israel.

Sentences_from: Albowiem pomagał mu Bóg przeciw Filistynom, i przeciw Arabczykom, którzy mieszkali w Gurbaalu, i przeciw Mahunitom.
Sentences_to: A man of God came to him, saying, "O king, don't let the army of Israel go with you; for Yahweh is not with Israel, with all the children of Ephraim.
Translated_sentences: For God helped him against the Philistines, and against the Arabs who lived in Gurbaal, and against the Mahunites.

Sentences_from: Poślij mi też drzewa cedrowego, jodłowego, i almugimowego z Libanu; bo ja wiem, iż słudzy twoi umieją wyrąbywać drzewo na Libanie; a oto słudzy moi będą z sługami twoimi,
Sentences_to: "Now therefore send me a man skillful to work in gold, and in silver, and in brass, and in iron, and in purple, and crimson, and blue, and who knows how to engrave engravings, to be with the skillful men who are with me in Judah and in Jerusalem, whom David my father provided.
Translated_sentences: Send me also cedar, fir, and almugim trees from Lebanon; for I know that your servants know how to carthue a tree in Lebanon; and behold, my servants shall be with thy servants,

Sentences_from: Do starości przywiódł ciało moje i skórę moję, a połamał kości moje.
Sentences_to: My flesh and my skin has he made old; he has broken my bones.
Translated_sentences: He brought my body and my skin to old age, and he broke my bones.

Sentences_from: Dlatego wyrzucę was z tej ziemi do ziemi, którejście nie znali, wy i ojcowie wasi, a tam służyć będziecie bogom cudzym we dnie i w nocy, dokąd wam nie okażę miłosierdzia.
Sentences_to: therefore will I cast you forth out of this land into the land that you have not known, neither you nor your fathers; and there you shall serve other gods day and night; for I will show you no favor.
Translated_sentences: That is why I will cast you out of this land into a land that you did not know, you and your fathers, and there you will serve the gods of others day and night, until I show you mercy.

Sentences_from: Tedy rzekł Dawid do Michol: Przed Panem (który mnie raczej obrał niż ojca twego, i niżeli wszystek dom jego, rozkazując mi, abym był książęciem nad ludem Pańskim, nad Izraelem.) grałem, i będę grał przed Panem.
Sentences_to: David said to Michal, "It was before Yahweh, who chose me above your father, and above all his house, to appoint me prince over the people of Yahweh, over Israel. Therefore will I celebrate before Yahweh.
Translated_sentences: Then david said to Michol, Before the Lord (who chose me rather than your father, and than all his house, commanding me to be a prince over the Lord's people, over Israel)) I have played, and I will play before the Lord.

Sentences_from: Ja mu będę za ojca, a on mi będzie za syna, który gdy wystąpi, skarzę go rózgą ludzką, i plagami synów człowieczych.
Sentences_to: I will be his father, and he shall be my son. If he commits iniquity, I will chasten him with the rod of men, and with the stripes of the children of men;
Translated_sentences: I will be for his father, and he will be for me for his son, who, when he performs, I will punish him with a rod of man, and with plagues of the sons of man.

Sentences_from: Wody wielkie nie mogłyby zagasić tej miłości, ani rzeki zatopić; choćby kto wszystkę majętność domu swego dał za takową miłość, byłby pewnie wzgardzony.
Sentences_to: Many waters can't quench love, neither can floods drown it. If a man would give all the wealth of his house for love, he would be utterly scorned. Friends
Translated_sentences: The great waters could not extinguish this love, nor could the river sink; even if he gives all the wealth of his house for such love, he would probably be despised.

Sentences_from: Co gdy ujrzeli mężowie Izraelscy, którzy za doliną, i za Jordanem mieszkali, iż uciekali mężowie Izraelscy, a iż umarł Saul, i synowie jego, odbieżawszy miast, pouciekali też, a przyszedłszy Filistynowie mieszkali w nich.
Sentences_to: David said to Abiathar the priest, the son of Ahimelech, "Please bring me here the ephod." Abiathar brought the ephod to David.
Translated_sentences: What when the men of Israel who lived behind the valley and behind the Jordan saw that the men of Israel were fleeing, and that Saul had died, and his sons, having fled the cities, also fled, and the coming Philistines lived in them.

Sentences_from: A gdy usłyszał król słowa ksiąg zakonu, rozdarł szaty swe.
Sentences_to: "Because Manasseh king of Judah has done these abominations, and has done wickedly above all that the Amorites did, who were before him, and has made Judah also to sin with his idols;
Translated_sentences: And when the king heard the words of the books of the law, he tore his garments.

Sentences_from: Syna Amaryjaszowego, syna Azaryjaszowego, syna Merajotowego,
Sentences_to: the son of Amariah, the son of Azariah, the son of Meraioth,
Translated_sentences: Son of Amaryas, son of Azariyas, son of Merajot,

Sentences_from: A do Zabulona rzekł: Wesel się Zabulon w wyjściu swem, a ty Isaschar w namiotach twoich.
Sentences_to: I will surely hide my face in that day for all the evil which they shall have worked, in that they are turned to other gods.
Translated_sentences: And to Zabulon he said, Rejoice Behold Zabulon in his exodus, and you Isaschar in your tents.

Sentences_from: Synów Azgadowych dwa tysiące trzy sta dwadzieścia i dwa;
Sentences_to: The children of Azgad, two thousand three hundred twenty-two.
Translated_sentences: Azgad sons two thousand three hundred and twenty and two;

Sentences_from: Sprawiedliwe są wszystkie słowa ust moich; nie masz w nich nic nieprawego ani przewrotnego.
Sentences_to: All the words of my mouth are in righteousness. There is nothing crooked or perverse in them.
Translated_sentences: All the words of my mouth are just; you have nothing wicked or perverse about them.

Sentences_from: Bo się rozszerzał mur w około im dalej tem bardziej z wierzchu dla komór, które były około domu, od wierzchu aż do dołu zewsząd w około domu, ponieważ on dom im dalej tem szerszy był od wierzchu, a tak najniższe komory rozszerzały się ku wierzchow i dla średniej komory.
Sentences_to: The side rooms were broader as they encompassed [the house] higher and higher; for the encompassing of the house went higher and higher around the house: therefore the breadth of the house [continued] upward; and so one went up [from] the lowest [room] to the highest by the middle [room].
Translated_sentences: For the wall expanded about the farther away from the top for the chambers which were about the house, from the top to the bottom from everywhere about the house, because the farther the house was wider than the top, and so the lowest chambers expanded towards the top and for the medium chamber.

Sentences_from: Wszystkie narody klaskajcie rękoma, wykrzykajcie Bogu głosem wesela.
Sentences_to: For Yahweh Most High is awesome. He is a great King over all the earth.
Translated_sentences: Clapp your hands to all nations, shout out to God with the voice of venerce.

Sentences_from: Przeczże ma być żal mój wieczny? a rana moja śmiertelna, która się uleczyć nie da? Przeczże mi tak masz być jako omylny, jako wody niepewne?
Sentences_to: Why is my pain perpetual, and my wound incurable, which refuses to be healed? Will you indeed be to me as a deceitful brook, as waters that fail?
Translated_sentences: Is it to be my eternal sorrow? and my mortal wound, which cannot be healed? After all, are you to be as fellible, as uncertain waters?

Sentences_from: A Hebrejczycy, którzy przedtem przestawali z Filistynami, którzy z nimi ciągnęli w obozie tam i sam, ci się też obróciwszy stanęli przy Izraelu, który był z Saulem i z Jonatanem.
Sentences_to: Now the Hebrews who were with the Philistines as before, and who went up with them into the camp, from all around, even they also turned to be with the Israelites who were with Saul and Jonathan.
Translated_sentences: And the Hebrews, who had previously stood with the Philistines, who had dragged them with them in the camp there and alone, and they also turned around with Israel, who was with Saul and Jonathan.

Sentences_from: I rzekł Bóg: Niech będą światła na rozpostarciu niebieskim, ku rozdzielaniu dnia od nocy, a niech będą na znaki, i pewne czasy, i dni, i lata.
Sentences_to: God said, "Let there be lights in the expanse of sky to divide the day from the night; and let them be for signs, and for seasons, and for days and years;
Translated_sentences: And God said, Let there be lights on the heavenly spread, for the separation of day from night, and let them be signs, and certain times, and days, and years.

Sentences_from: Wzięliśmy też wszystkie miasta jego na on czas; nie było miasta, którego byśmy im nie wzięli, sześćdziesiąt miast, wszystkę krainę Argob królestwa Ogowego w Basan.
Sentences_to: We took all his cities at that time; there was not a city which we didn't take from them; sixty cities, all the region of Argob, the kingdom of Og in Bashan.
Translated_sentences: We also took all the cities of his time; there was no city that we did not take from them, sixty cities, all the Argob land of the Ogau kingdom of Basan.

Sentences_from: I będziesz się weselił w święto uroczyste twoje, ty, i syn twój, i córka twoja, i sługa twój, i służebnica twoja, i Lewita, i przychodzień, i sierota, i wdowa, którzy będą w bramach twoich.
Sentences_to: you shall furnish him liberally out of your flock, and out of your threshing floor, and out of your winepress; as Yahweh your God has blessed you, you shall give to him.
Translated_sentences: And thou shy thou shy glad in the solemn feast, thou shy, and thy son, and thy daughter, and thy servant, and thy handmaid, and levite, and the coming, and the orphan, and the widow, who shall be at thy gates.

Sentences_from: Tedym była u niego jako wychowaniec, i byłam uciechą jego na każdy dzień, grając przed nim na każdy czas.
Sentences_to: then I was the craftsman by his side. I was a delight day by day, always rejoicing before him,
Translated_sentences: Then she was with him as an upbringing, and I was his delight for every day, playing in front of him for every time.

Sentences_from: Przedniejszemu śpiewakowi psalm Dawidowy. Głupi rzekł w sercu swojem: Niemasz Boga. Popsowali się, obrzydliwymi się stali w zabawach swoich: niemasz, ktoby czynił dobrze.
Sentences_to: < < For the Chief Musician. By David. > > The fool has said in his heart, "There is no God." They are corrupt. They have done abominable works. There is none who does good.
Translated_sentences: To the foreman singer the Psalm of David. The fool said in his heart, You have no God. They broke down, they became disgusting in their games: there is no one who would do good.

Sentences_from: Albowiem serce ich myśli o drapiestwie, a wargi ich mówią o uciśnieniu.
Sentences_to: for their hearts plot violence, and their lips talk about mischief.
Translated_sentences: For their heart thinks of drapiest, and their lips speak of oppression.

Sentences_from: Szczerym w ciemnościach światłość wschodzi; łaskawy, miłosierny, i sprawiedliwy jest Bóg.
Sentences_to: Light dawns in the darkness for the upright, gracious, merciful, and righteous.
Translated_sentences: To the sincere in the darkness the light rises; God is gracious, merciful, and just.

Sentences_from: Żądza sprawiedliwych jest zawżdy ku dobremu; ale oczekiwanie niepobożnych, popędliwość.
Sentences_to: The desire of the righteous is only good. The expectation of the wicked is wrath.
Translated_sentences: The lust of the righteous is always for good; but the expectation of the impious, the rush.

Sentences_from: Odpowiedział mu młodzieniec, który mu to oznajmił: Przyszedłem z trafunku na górę Gilboe, a oto, Saul tkwiał na włóczni swojej, a wozy i jezdni doganiali go.
Sentences_to: The young man who told him said, "As I happened by chance on Mount Gilboa, behold, Saul was leaning on his spear; and behold, the chariots and the horsemen followed hard after him.
Translated_sentences: A young man replied, who told him, "I have come from the trafunk to Mount Gilboe, and behold, Saul was stuck on his spear, and the wagons and the roadway were catching up with him."

Sentences_from: Obejrzyj się na przymierze twoje; albowiem i najciemniejsze kąty ziemi pełne jaskió drapiestwa.
Sentences_to: Honor your covenant, for haunts of violence fill the dark places of the earth.
Translated_sentences: Look to your covenant; for the darkest corners of the earth full of caves of scratching.

Sentences_from: Przetoż odszedł król Izraelski do domu swego smutny i zagniewany, i przyszedł do Samaryi.
Sentences_to: The king of Israel went to his house sullen and angry, and came to Samaria.
Translated_sentences: Therefore the king of Israel went to his house, sad and angry, and came to Samarya.

Sentences_from: Baliście się miecza; ale miecz przywiodę na was, mówi panujący Pan.
Sentences_to: You have feared the sword; and I will bring the sword on you, says the Lord Yahweh.
Translated_sentences: You were afraid of the sword; but I will bring the sword upon you, says the reigning Lord.

Sentences_from: Także gdy wnijdziesz między zboże bliźniego twego, tedy narwiesz kłosów ręką twą; ale sierpa nie zapuszczaj w zboże bliźniego twego.
Sentences_to: but to the lady you shall do nothing; there is in the lady no sin worthy of death: for as when a man rises against his neighbor, and kills him, even so is this matter;
Translated_sentences: Even when you enter among the grain of your neighbor, you will cut the ears with your hand; but do not grow a sickle into the grain of your neighbor.

Sentences_from: A tak lamentując król nad Abnerem, rzekł: Izali tak miał umrzeć Abner, jako umiera nikczemnik?
Sentences_to: The king lamented for Abner, and said, "Should Abner die as a fool dies?
Translated_sentences: And so, lamenting the king over Abner, said, Isali so Abner was to die, as a wicked man was dying?

Sentences_from: Tam Mesech, Tubal i wszystka zgraja jego, i w około niego groby jego, ci wszyscy nieobrzezaócy pobici mieczem, choć puszczali strach swój w ziemi żyjących.
Sentences_to: There is Meshech, Tubal, and all their multitude; their graves are around them; all of them uncircumcised, slain by the sword; for they caused their terror in the land of the living.
Translated_sentences: There Mesech, Tubal, and all his company, and his graves about him, all those uncircumcised men were beaten with the sword, though they let go of their fear in the land of the living.

Sentences_from: Oto Ja pobudzę przeciwko nim Medów, którzy o srebro nie będą dbali, a w złocie nie będą się kochali;
Sentences_to: Behold, I will stir up the Medes against them, who will not value silver, and as for gold, they will not delight in it.
Translated_sentences: Behold, I will stir up against them the Medes, who will not care for silver, and in gold they will not love each other;

Sentences_from: Ale się na każdy poranek odnawiają; wielka jest prawda twoja.
Sentences_to: They are new every morning; great is your faithfulness.
Translated_sentences: But they renew themselves every morning; great is your truth.

Sentences_from: Moc moja i chwała moja Pan, bo mi się stał zbawieniem; ten jest Bogiem moim, przetoż przybytek wystawię mu; Bóg ojca mego, przetoż wywyższać go będę.
Sentences_to: Yah is my strength and song. He has become my salvation. This is my God, and I will praise him; my father's God, and I will exalt him.
Translated_sentences: My power and my Lord's glory, for he has become my salvation; this is my God, and I will expose the tabernacle to him; The God of my father, therefore I will exalt him.

Sentences_from: A imię żony Abisurowej Abihail, która mu urodziła Achobbana i Molida.
Sentences_to: The name of the wife of Abishur was Abihail; and she bore him Ahban, and Molid.
Translated_sentences: And the name of his wife Abisura Abihail, who bore him Achobbana and Molid.

Sentences_from: Wystawił mię zaiste na przypowieść ludziom, i jako śmiechowisko przed nimi.
Sentences_to: "But he has made me a byword of the people. They spit in my face.
Translated_sentences: He exposed me to the parable of the people, and as a laughing stock before them.

Sentences_from: Budując sobie nierządne domy na rozstaniu każdego gościńca, a wyżynę sobie stawiając w każdej ulicy, owszem pogardzając zapłatą nie jesteś ani jako wszetecznica,
Sentences_to: in that you build your vaulted place at the head of every way, and make your lofty place in every street, and have not been as a prostitute, in that you scorn pay.
Translated_sentences: Building for yourself harlot houses on the parting of every inn, and putting the highland in every street, yes, despising the payment you are neither as a harlot,

Sentences_from: Pieśó stopni. Gdy zaś Pan nawrócił pojmanych z Syonu, byliśmy jako ci, którym się śni.
Sentences_to: < < A Song of Ascents. > > When Yahweh brought back those who returned to Zion, we were like those who dream.
Translated_sentences: A song of degrees. And when the Lord converted the captured from Zion, we were as dreamers.

Sentences_from: Choćby i nazbyt miał wszystkiego, ściśniony będzie; wszelka ręka trapiących oburzy się nań.
Sentences_to: In the fullness of his sufficiency, distress shall overtake him. The hand of everyone who is in misery shall come on him.
Translated_sentences: Even if he had too much of everything, he will be squeezed; every hand of the troublemakers will be indign at it.

Sentences_from: Trzody ich, i majętności ich, i wszystkie bydła ich, azaż nie nasze będą? na to tylko im pozwólmy, a będą mieszkać z nami.
Sentences_to: Won't their livestock and their possessions and all their animals be ours? Only let us give our consent to them, and they will dwell with us."
Translated_sentences: Their flocks, and their wealth, and all their cattle, and they shall not be ours? let's just let them do it, and they will live with us.

Sentences_from: Teć są dni lat żywota Abrahamowego, które przeżył, sto i siedemdziesiąt, i pięć lat.
Sentences_to: These are the days of the years of Abraham's life which he lived: one hundred seventy-five years.
Translated_sentences: These are the days of the years of Abraham's life that he lived, one hundred and seventy, and five years.

Sentences_from: Syn Heseda w Arubot, który trzymał Socho i wszystkę ziemię Chefer;
Sentences_to: Ben Hesed, in Arubboth (to him belonged Socoh, and all the land of Hepher);
Translated_sentences: Son of Hesed in Arubot, who held Socho and all the land of Chefer;

Sentences_from: Bogaty nad ubogimi panuje; ale ten, co pożycza, sługą bywa tego, który mu pożycza.
Sentences_to: The rich rule over the poor. The borrower is servant to the lender.
Translated_sentences: The rich rule over the poor; but he who borrows is the servant of the one who lends him.

Sentences_from: Tedyćby nas byli żywo pożarli w rozpaleniu gniewu swego przeciwko nam;
Sentences_to: then they would have swallowed us up alive, when their wrath was kindled against us;
Translated_sentences: Therefore, that they may devour us vividly in kindling their wrath against us;

Sentences_from: Tedy będę nauczał przestępców dróg twoich, aby się grzesznicy do ciebie nawrócili.
Sentences_to: Lord, open my lips. My mouth shall declare your praise.
Translated_sentences: Therefore I will teach the criminals your ways, that sinners may be converted to you.

Sentences_from: To, co było, teraz jest, a co będzie, już było; albowiem Bóg odnawia to, co przeminęło.
Sentences_to: That which is has been long ago, and that which is to be has been long ago: and God seeks again that which is passed away.
Translated_sentences: What was, now is, and what will be, has already been; for God renews that which is gone.

Sentences_from: Jedni w wozach, a drudzy w koniach ufają; ale my na imię Pana, Boga naszego, wspominamy.
Sentences_to: They are bowed down and fallen, but we rise up, and stand upright.
Translated_sentences: Some in carts and others in horses trust; but we remember the name of the Lord our God.

Sentences_from: Zda się pod czas droga być prosta człowiekowi; wszakże dokończenie jej jest drogą na śmierć.
Sentences_to: There is a way which seems right to a man, but in the end it leads to death.
Translated_sentences: It will seem in time that the way will be straightforward to man; after all, finishing it is the way to death.

Sentences_from: Który zgromadził jako na kupę wody morskie, i złożył do skarbu przepaści.
Sentences_to: He gathers the waters of the sea together as a heap. He lays up the deeps in storehouses.
Translated_sentences: Who gathered as a pile of sea waters, and deposited into the treasure of the abyss.

Sentences_from: Nadto i sabaty moje dałem im, aby były znakiem między mną i między nimi, aby wiedzieli, żem Ja jest Pan, który ich poświęcam.
Sentences_to: Moreover also I gave them my Sabbaths, to be a sign between me and them, that they might know that I am Yahweh who sanctifies them.
Translated_sentences: Moreover, I have given them my Sabbaths, that they may be a sign between me and between them, that they may know that I am the Lord who consecrates them.

Sentences_from: A miasto było szerokie i wielkie, ale ludu mało w murach jego, a jeszcze nie były domy pobudowane.
Sentences_to: Now the city was wide and large; but the people were few therein, and the houses were not built.
Translated_sentences: And the city was wide and large, but there were few people within its walls, and there were no houses built yet.

Sentences_from: Kto strzeże drzewa figowego, pożywa owocu jego; także kto strzeże pana swego, uczczony będzie.
Sentences_to: Whoever tends the fig tree shall eat its fruit. He who looks after his master shall be honored.
Translated_sentences: He who guards the fig tree feeds on its fruit; even whoever guards his master will be honored.

Sentences_from: Ale ja w tobie mam nadzieję, Panie! Rzekłem: Tyś jest Bogiem moim.
Sentences_to: My times are in your hand. Deliver me from the hand of my enemies, and from those who persecute me.
Translated_sentences: But I hope in you, Lord! I said, You are my God.

Sentences_from: I rzekłem do Anioła, który mówił zemną: Cóż to jest? I rzekł do mnie: Teć są rogi, które rozrzuciły Judę i Izraela i Jeruzalem.
Sentences_to: Then I asked, "Where are you going?" He said to me, "To measure Jerusalem, to see what is its breadth and what is its length."
Translated_sentences: And I said to the angel who said to me, What is this? And he said to me, Teć are the horns that scattered Judah and Israel and Jerusalem.

Sentences_from: Gdy tedy Izraelczycy pobili wszystkie obywatele Haj na polu przy puszczy, tedy za nimi szli w pogoó, a polegli oni wszyscy od miecza, aż wygładzeni są; obrócili się wszyscy Izraelczycy do Haj, i wysiekli je ostrzem miecza.
Sentences_to: It happened, when Israel had made an end of killing all the inhabitants of Ai in the field, in the wilderness in which they pursued them, and they had all fallen by the edge of the sword, until they were consumed, that all Israel returned to Ai, and struck it with the edge of the sword.
Translated_sentences: When the Israelites, therefore, beat all the citizens of Haj in the field by the wilderness, they followed them into the wilderness, and they all fell by the sword until they were smoothed; all the Israelis turned to Haj, and peed them with the blade of the sword.

Sentences_from: Przysiągł Pan przez prawicę swoję i przez ramię mocy swojej, mówiąc: Nie podam więcej pszenicy twojej na pokarm nieprzyjaciołom twoim, i nie będą pić cudzoziemcy wina twego, około któregoś pracował.
Sentences_to: Yahweh has sworn by his right hand, and by the arm of his strength, "Surely I will no more give your grain to be food for your enemies; and foreigners shall not drink your new wine, for which you have labored:
Translated_sentences: The Lord swore by his right hand and by the arm of his power, saying, I will not give your wheat more for food to your enemies, and foreigners shall not drink your wine about one of whom he worked.

Sentences_from: Roku dwudziestego i trzeciego Joaza, syna Ochozyjasza, króla Judzkiego, królował Joachaz, syn Jehu, nad Izraelem w Samaryi siedmnaście lat.
Sentences_to: In the seventh year of Jehu began Jehoash to reign; and he reigned forty years in Jerusalem: and his mother's name was Zibiah of Beersheba.
Translated_sentences: In the twentieth and third years of Joaz, son of Ochosiah, king of Judah, Joachaz, son of Jehu, reigned over Israel in Samarya for for fifty years.

Sentences_from: Leniwiec rękę kryje do zanadrzy swych, a ciężko mu jej podnosić do ust swoich.
Sentences_to: The sluggard buries his hand in the dish. He is too lazy to bring it back to his mouth.
Translated_sentences: The sloth hides his hand to his own reins, and it is difficult for him to raise it to his mouth.

Sentences_from: Rozstępując rozstąpi się ziemia; rozsiadając rozsiądzie się ziemia; poruszając poruszy się ziemia.
