Sentences_to: Some of the Philistines brought Jehoshaphat presents, and silver for tribute; the Arabians also brought him flocks, seven thousand and seven hundred rams, and seven thousand and seven hundred male goats.
Translated_sentences: Therefore all the prophets prophesied, saying, Draw to Ramot Galaad, and it shall be blessed; for the Lord will give them into the hands of the king.

Sentences_from: I rzekła niewiasta do węża: Z owocu drzewa sadu tego pożywamy;
Sentences_to: The woman said to the serpent, "Of the fruit of the trees of the garden we may eat,
Translated_sentences: And the woman said to the serpent, We feed from the fruit of the tree of the orchard;

Sentences_from: Słowo, które się stało do Jeremijasza od Pana mówiąc:
Sentences_to: The word which came to Jeremiah from Yahweh, saying,
Translated_sentences: The word that happened to Jeremiah of the Lord, saying:

Sentences_from: Oto dni idą, mówi Pan, w których nawiedzę każdego obrzezańca i nieobrzezańca:
Sentences_to: but let him who glories glory in this, that he has understanding, and knows me, that I am Yahweh who exercises loving kindness, justice, and righteousness, in the earth: for in these things I delight, says Yahweh.
Translated_sentences: Behold, the days are coming, saith the Lord, in which I will come to every circumcise and uncircumcised:

Sentences_from: Przetoż wylałem gniew mój na nich dla krwi, którą wylali na ziemię, i dla plugawych bałwanów ich, któremi ją splugawili.
Sentences_to: Therefore I poured out my wrath on them for the blood which they had poured out on the land, and because they had defiled it with their idols;
Translated_sentences: Therefore I poured out my wrath upon them for the blood which they poured out on the earth, and for their filthy idols, who defiled it.

Sentences_from: I stało się, gdy było utwierdzone królestwo jego, że pomordował sługi swe, którzy zabili króla, ojca jego.
Sentences_to: Jehoiada took for him two wives; and he became the father of sons and daughters.
Translated_sentences: And it happened when his kingdom was established that he had murdered his servants, who had killed the king, his father.

Sentences_from: Który nasyca dobrem usta twoje, a odnawia jako orła młodość twoję.
Sentences_to: who satisfies your desire with good things, so that your youth is renewed like the eagle's.
Translated_sentences: Who saturates your lips with goodness and renews your youth as an eagle.

Sentences_from: Który im rzekł: Po trzech dniach wróćcie się do mnie. I odszedł lud.
Sentences_to: He said to them, "Come again to me after three days." The people departed.
Translated_sentences: Who said to them, After three days, come back to me. And the people went away.

Sentences_from: A teć są pokolenia Ezawa, ojca Edomczyków, na górze Seir.
Sentences_to: This is the history of the generations of Esau the father of the Edomites in the hill country of Seir:
Translated_sentences: And there are generations of Esau, the father of the Edomians, on Mount Seir.

Sentences_from: Pan króluje, oblekł się w dostojność; oblekł się Pan w możność, i przepasał się; utwierdził też okrąg świata, aby się nie poruszył.
Sentences_to: Yahweh reigns! He is clothed with majesty! Yahweh is armed with strength. The world also is established. It can't be moved.
Translated_sentences: The Lord reigns, he has clothed himself in dignity; the Lord clothed Himself in the power, and girded Himself; he also fixed the circle of the world so that he would not move.

Sentences_from: Co się tknie spraw ludzkich według słowa ust twoich, chroniłem się drogi okrutnika.
Sentences_to: As for the works of men, by the word of your lips, I have kept myself from the ways of the violent.
Translated_sentences: Whatever touches human affairs according to the word of your mouth, I have protected myself, dear cruelty.

Sentences_from: Choć i plewy i siano mam dla osłów naszych, także chleb i wino mam dla siebie i dla służebnicy twej i dla sługi, który jest ze mną, sługą twoim; nie mam niedostatku z żadnej rzeczy.
Sentences_to: Yet there is both straw and provender for our donkeys; and there is bread and wine also for me, and for your handmaid, and for the young man who is with your servants: there is no want of anything."
Translated_sentences: Though I have chaves and hay for our don donves, I also have bread and wine for myself and for your servant and for the servant who is with me, your servant; I have no shortage of an at all things.

Sentences_from: Ale jeźliby kto umyślnie przeciw bliźniemu swemu zasadziwszy się zdradą zabił go, i od ołtarza mego weźmiesz go, aby umarł.
Sentences_to: If a man schemes and comes presumptuously on his neighbor to kill him, you shall take him from my altar, that he may die.
Translated_sentences: But if he who deliberately against his neighbor ambushed himself with betrayal killed him, and from my altar tie will take him to die.

Sentences_from: Królowie z wojskami uciekali, uciekali: ale ta, która przyglądała domu, dzieliła łupy.
Sentences_to: while you sleep among the campfires, the wings of a dove sheathed with silver, her feathers with shining gold.
Translated_sentences: Kings with troops fled, fled: but the one who looked at the house shared the spoils.

Sentences_from: I rzekł: Cóż to za słowa, któreć Pan powiedział? proszę nie taj przedemną; to a toć Bóg niechaj uczyni, jeźliże co zataisz przedemną ze wszystkich słów, które mówił do ciebie.
Sentences_to: He said, "What is the thing that he has spoken to you? Please don't hide it from me. God do so to you, and more also, if you hide anything from me of all the things that he spoke to you."
Translated_sentences: And he said, What are these words which the Lord has spoken? please do not secret the foreground; let God do this, if what you conceal from me from all the words He spoke to you.

Sentences_from: Nie zataiła się żadna kość moja przed tobą, chociażem był uczyniony w skrytości, i misternie złożony w niskościach ziemi.
Sentences_to: My frame wasn't hidden from you, when I was made in secret, woven together in the depths of the earth.
Translated_sentences: No bone of mine has been hidden from you, though it was made in secret, and intricately folded in the lowness of the earth.

Sentences_from: I rzekłem: Cóż jest? A on odpowiedział: To jest efa wychodzące. Potem rzekł: Toć jest oko ich przypatrujące się wszystkiej ziemi.
Sentences_to: I said, "What is it?" He said, "This is the ephah basket that is appearing." He said moreover, "This is their appearance in all the land
Translated_sentences: And I said, What is it? And he said, "This is an efa coming out." Then he said, "This is their eye looking at all the earth.

Sentences_from: Aza cię będzie karał bojąc się ciebie? albo z tobą pójdzie do sądu?
Sentences_to: Is it for your piety that he reproves you, that he enters with you into judgment?
Translated_sentences: Will Aza punish you by fear of you? or will he go to court with you?

Sentences_from: I do Hebronu, i Rohob, i Hamon, i Kana, aż do Sydonu wielkiego.
Sentences_to: and Ebron, Rehob, Hammon, and Kanah, even to great Sidon.
Translated_sentences: And to Hebron, and Rohob, and Hamon, and Cana, up to Sidon the great.

Sentences_from: Ale lud rzekł do Saula: Izali Jonatan umrze, który uczynił to wybawienie wielkie w Izraelu? Boże uchowaj! jako żywy Pan, nie spadnie i włos z głowy jego na ziemię; albowiem za pomocą Bożą uczynił to dzisiaj. A tak wybawił lud Jonatana, że nie umarł.
Sentences_to: The people said to Saul, "Shall Jonathan die, who has worked this great salvation in Israel? Far from it! As Yahweh lives, there shall not one hair of his head fall to the ground; for he has worked with God this day!" So the people rescued Jonathan, that he didn't die.
Translated_sentences: But the people said to Saul, Isali Jonathan will die, who did this great deliverance in Israel? God forbid! as a living Lord, he will not fall a hair from his head to the ground; for by the help of God he did it today. And so he saved Jonathan's people that he did not die.

Sentences_from: Tedy król Daryjusz rozkazał, aby szukano w biblijotece między skarbami tamże złożonemi w Babilonie.
Sentences_to: Then Darius the king made a decree, and search was made in the house of the archives, where the treasures were laid up in Babylon.
Translated_sentences: Then King Darius ordered that the treasures deposited there in Babylon should be sought in the Bible library.

Sentences_from: Niech będą przed Panem ustawicznie, ażby wygładził z ziemi pamiątkę ich,
Sentences_to: Let them be before Yahweh continually, that he may cut off their memory from the earth;
Translated_sentences: Let them be before the Lord continually, until he smooths out of the earth the memorial of them,

Sentences_from: Nadto wszystkie naczynia, z których pijał król Salomon, były złote, także i wszystkie naczynia domu lasu Libanowego były z szczerego złota; nic nie było ze srebra, ani go miano w jakiej cenie za dni Salomonowych.
Sentences_to: All king Solomon's drinking vessels were of gold, and all the vessels of the house of the forest of Lebanon were of pure gold: none were of silver; it was nothing accounted of in the days of Solomon.
Translated_sentences: Moreover, all the vessels from which King Solomon drank were golden, and all the vessels of the house of the Lebanese forest were of pure gold; there was nothing of silver, nor was it called at what price for solomon's days.

Sentences_from: Niech nam dadzą dwóch cielców, a niech sobie obiorą cielca jednego, a porąbią go na sztuki, i włożą na drwa; ale ognia niech nie podkładają: ja też przygotuję drugiego cielca, którego włożę na drwa, a ognia nie podłożę.
Sentences_to: Let them therefore give us two bulls; and let them choose one bull for themselves, and cut it in pieces, and lay it on the wood, and put no fire under; and I will dress the other bull, and lay it on the wood, and put no fire under it.
Translated_sentences: Let them give us two bulls, and let them take one calf, and chop it into pieces, and put it on wood; but let them not set fire: I too will prepare a second calf, which I will put on the wood, and I will not set fire.

Sentences_from: Gdy się wrzuci garść zboża do ziemi na wierzchu gór, zaszumi jako Liban urodzaj jego, a mieszczanie zakwitną jako zioła polne.
Sentences_to: Abundance of grain shall be throughout the land. Its fruit sways like Lebanon. Let it flourish, thriving like the grass of the field.
Translated_sentences: When a handful of grain is thrown into the ground on top of the mountains, Lebanon will be flooded with its harvest, and the townspeople will bloom as field herbs.

Sentences_from: Tedy każesz zatrąbić w trąbę huczną miesiąca siódmego, dnia dziesiątego tegoż miesiąca; w dzień oczyszczenia każecie zatrąbić po wszystkiej ziemi waszej.
Sentences_to: It shall be for Aaron and his sons; and they shall eat it in a holy place: for it is most holy to him of the offerings of Yahweh made by fire by a perpetual statute."
Translated_sentences: Then thou has the trumpet of the seventh month, the tenth day of that month, trumpeted; on the day of purification you make you honk yours all over your land.

Sentences_from: I postanowili, aby obwołano po wszystkim Izraelu, od Beersaby aż do Dan, żeby się zeszli na obchód święta przejścia Panu, Bogu Izraelskiemu, do Jeruzalemu; albowiem już go dawno nie obchodzili, jako było napisane.
Sentences_to: and said to them, "Listen to me, you Levites! Now sanctify yourselves, and sanctify the house of Yahweh, the God of your fathers, and carry out the filthiness out of the holy place.
Translated_sentences: And they decided that Israel, from Beersaba to Dan, should be proclaimed after all, that they should go down to the feast of the passage of the Lord God israel to Jerusalem; for they no longer cared for him as it was written.

Sentences_from: Jako lilija między cierniem, tak przyjaciółka moja między pannami.
Sentences_to: As a lily among thorns, so is my love among the daughters. Beloved
Translated_sentences: As a lily between the thorns, so my friend between the virgins.

Sentences_from: I rzekł Pan do Kaina: Gdzież jest Abel brat twój? który odpowiedział: Nie wiem; izalim ja stróżem brata mego?
Sentences_to: Yahweh said to Cain, "Where is Abel, your brother?" He said, "I don't know. Am I my brother's keeper?"
Translated_sentences: And the Lord said to Cain, Where is Abel your brother? who replied, "I don't know; Am I my brother's keeper?

Sentences_from: Tedy posłał Sanballat, i Giesem do mnie mówiąc: Przyjdź, a zejdźmy się społem we wsiach, które są na polu Ono. Ale oni myślili uczynić mi co złego.
Sentences_to: that Sanballat and Geshem sent to me, saying, "Come, let us meet together in the villages in the plain of Ono." But they intended to harm me.
Translated_sentences: Then he sent Sanballat, and Giesem to me, saying, Come, and let us come down in the villages that are in the field of Ono. But they thought to do something wrong to me.

Sentences_from: Wywyższaj ją, a wywyższy cię, rozsławi cię, gdy ją przyjmiesz.
Sentences_to: Esteem her, and she will exalt you. She will bring you to honor, when you embrace her.
Translated_sentences: Exalt it, and exalting you, it will make you famous when you receive it.

Sentences_from: Społem przeciwko mnie szepczą wszyscy, którzy mię mają w nienawiści, a myślą złe o mnie,
Sentences_to: "An evil disease," they say, "has afflicted him. Now that he lies he shall rise up no more."
Translated_sentences: All those who hate me and think badly of me whisper against me,

Sentences_from: Albowiem rzekł Dawid: Dał odpocznienie Pan, Bóg Izraelski, ludowi swemu, i będzie mieszkał w Jeruzalemie aż na wieki.
Sentences_to: For David said, "Yahweh, the God of Israel, has given rest to his people; and he dwells in Jerusalem forever.
Translated_sentences: For David said, The Lord God of Israel gave rest to his people, and will dwell in Jerusalem forever.

Sentences_from: Od tych, którzy opuszczają ścieszki proste, udawając się drogami ciemnemi;
Sentences_to: who forsake the paths of uprightness, to walk in the ways of darkness;
Translated_sentences: From those who leave the straight paths, going along dark roads;

Sentences_from: I stało się, gdy dokończył Salomon budowania domu Pańskiego, i domu królewskiego, i wszystkiego, co żądał Salomon i chciał uczynić,
Sentences_to: It happened, when Solomon had finished the building of the house of Yahweh, and the king's house, and all Solomon's desire which he was pleased to do,
Translated_sentences: And it happened when Solomon finished building the house of the Lord, and the king's house, and all that Solomon demanded and wanted to do,

Sentences_from: Nie przystoi mowa poważna głupiemu, dopieroż księciu usta kłamliwe.
Sentences_to: Arrogant speech isn't fitting for a fool, much less do lying lips fit a prince.
Translated_sentences: It is not befits a stupid fool to have a serious speech, a prince's mouth is deceitful.

Sentences_from: Tedy synowie Aaronowi, Nadab i Abiju, wziąwszy każdy kadzielnicę swoję, włożyli w nią ognia, i włożywszy nań kadzidła ofiarowali przed obliczem Pańskiem ogieó obcy, czego im był nie rozkazał.
Sentences_to: It happened on the eighth day, that Moses called Aaron and his sons, and the elders of Israel;
Translated_sentences: Therefore the sons of Aaron, Nadab and Abiju, taking each of their censer, put fire on it, and putting incense on it, offered before the Lord a stranger, which he did not command them.

Sentences_from: Droga Pańska jest mocą szczeremu; ale strachem tym, którzy broją złości.
Sentences_to: The way of Yahweh is a stronghold to the upright, but it is a destruction to the workers of iniquity.
Translated_sentences: The way of the Lord is the power of the sincere; but fear to those who are angry.

Sentences_from: Tedy krzyczał lud, gdy zatrąbiono w trąby, albowiem gdy usłyszał lud głos trąb, krzyczał i lud wielkim głosem, i upadł mur na miejscu swem, i wszedł lud do miasta, każdy przeciw miejscu, gdzie stał, i wzięli miasto;
Sentences_to: So the people shouted, and the priests blew the trumpets. It happened, when the people heard the sound of the trumpet, that the people shouted with a great shout, and the wall fell down flat, so that the people went up into the city, every man straight before him, and they took the city.
Translated_sentences: And the people cried out when the trumpets were trumpeted, for when the people heard the voice of the trumpets, they cried out and the people with a great voice, and the wall fell in their place, and the people entered the city, each against the place where he stood, and they took the city;

Sentences_from: Wystąpili przeciwko Panu, bo synów cudzych napłodzili; a tak teraz pożre ich miesiąc z majętnościami ich.
Sentences_to: As they were multiplied, so they sinned against me. I will change their glory into shame.
Translated_sentences: They went against the Lord because they had beheaded the sons of others; and so now a month will devour them with their wealth.

Sentences_from: I będą żywotem duszy twojej, a ozdobą szyi twojej.
Sentences_to: so they will be life to your soul, and grace for your neck.
Translated_sentences: And they will be the life of your soul, and the adornment of your neck.

Sentences_from: Jako gdyby kto uciekał przede lwem, a zabieżał mu niedźwiedź; albo gdyby wszedł do domu, a podparł się ręką swą na ścianie, ukąsiłby go wąż.
Sentences_to: As if a man fled from a lion, and a bear met him; Or he went into the house and leaned his hand on the wall, and a snake bit him.
Translated_sentences: As if anyone ran away from the lion and the bear killed him; or if he had entered the house and leaned his hand against the wall, he would have been bitten by a serpent.

Sentences_from: Przetoż będę cię wyznawał Panie między narodami; a imieniowi twemu śpiewać będę.
Sentences_to: Therefore I will give thanks to you, Yahweh, among the nations. Will sing praises to your name.
Translated_sentences: Therefore I will confess you, Lord, among the nations; and to thy name I shall sing.

Sentences_from: Zbudował też przegrodzenie na dwadzieścia łokci wdłuż od strony do strony domu, z tarcic cedrowych od tła aż do stropu. A tak zbudował Bogu wewnątrz przybytek, aby był świątnicą najświętszą.
Sentences_to: He built twenty cubits on the hinder part of the house with boards of cedar from the floor to the ceiling: he built them for it within, for an oracle, even for the most holy place.
Translated_sentences: He also built a twenty-elbow fence extended from side to side of the house, made of cedar timber from the background to the ceiling. And so he built the tabernacle for God within, so that it would be the holiest temple.

Sentences_from: Zaiste kielich jest w rękach Pańskich, a ten wina mętnego nalany; z tegoż nalewać będzie, tak, że i drożdże jego wyssą i wypiją wszyscy niepobożni ziemi.
Sentences_to: But I will declare this forever: I will sing praises to the God of Jacob.
Translated_sentences: Indeed, the cup is in the hands of the Lord, and this wine of the turbid is poured; from this he will pour, so that his yeast will also suck and drink all the wicked of the earth.

Sentences_from: Ale ty i słudzy twoi, wiem, że się jeszcze nie boicie oblicza Pana Boga.
Sentences_to: But as for you and your servants, I know that you don't yet fear Yahweh God."
Translated_sentences: But you and your servants know that you are not yet afraid of the face of God.

Sentences_from: Gdy mawiał Efraim, strach bywał, bo był wywyższony w Izraelu; ale gdy zgrzeszył przy Baalu, tedy umarł.
Sentences_to: Ephraim feeds on wind, and chases the east wind. He continually multiplies lies and desolation. They make a covenant with Assyria, and oil is carried into Egypt.
Translated_sentences: When Ephraim said, there was fear because he was exalted in Israel; but when he sinned at Baal, he died.

Sentences_from: I rzekł Pan do Mojżesza, mówiąc:
Sentences_to: "'They shall therefore follow my requirements, lest they bear sin for it, and die therein, if they profane it. I am Yahweh who sanctifies them.
Translated_sentences: And the Lord said to Moses, saying,

Sentences_from: Którego długość przy drzwiach na północy była na wejrzeniu na sto łokci, a szerokość na pięćdziesiąt łokci.
Sentences_to: Before the length of one hundred cubits was the north door, and the breadth was fifty cubits.
Translated_sentences: Whose length at the door to the north was at the look of one hundred cubits, and the width of which was fifty cubits.

Sentences_from: Niech się rozradują niebiosa, a niech się rozweseli ziemia, a niech mówią w narodach: Pan króluje!
Sentences_to: Let the heavens be glad, and let the earth rejoice! Let them say among the nations, "Yahweh reigns!"
Translated_sentences: Let the heavens rejoice, and let the earth rejoice, and let them say in the nations: The Lord reigns!

Sentences_from: Tedy opowiem imię twoje braciom mym; w pośród zgromadzenia chwalić cię będę.
Sentences_to: You who fear Yahweh, praise him! All you descendants of Jacob, glorify him! Stand in awe of him, all you descendants of Israel!
Translated_sentences: Then I will tell your name to my brethren; in the midst of the assembly I will praise you.

Sentences_from: A tak przyszedł Dawid, i wszystek Izrael do Baala w Karyjatyjarym, które jest w Judzie, aby przyprowadzili stamtąd skrzynię Pana Boga siedzącego nad Cherubinami, gdzie wzywane bywa imię jego.
Sentences_to: David went up, and all Israel, to Baalah, that is, to Kiriath Jearim, which belonged to Judah, to bring up from there the ark of God Yahweh that sits above the cherubim, that is called by the Name.
Translated_sentences: And so came David, and all Israel to Baal in Karyatyarya, which is in Juda, to bring from there the chest of the Lord God sitting over the Cherubim, where his name is invoked.

Sentences_from: Zostawiali tedy ono na jutro, jako był rozkazał Mojżesz; a nie zśmierdło się, i robak nie był w niem.
Sentences_to: They laid it up until the morning, as Moses asked, and it didn't become foul, neither was there any worm in it.
Translated_sentences: They thess left it for tomorrow, as Moses had commanded; and it did not perish, and the worm was not in it.

Sentences_from: Tedy rzekł jeden do drugiego: Chodźcie, rzućmy losy, abyśmy się dowiedzieli, dla kogo to złe na nas przyszło; rzucili tedy losy, i padł los na Jonasza.
Sentences_to: They all said to each other, "Come, let us cast lots, that we may know who is responsible for this evil that is on us." So they cast lots, and the lot fell on Jonah.
Translated_sentences: Then he said to one another, Come, let us cast lots, that we may know for whom this evil has come upon us; so they cast lots, and fate fell on Jonah.

Sentences_from: Wielbijcie Pana ze mną, a wywyższajmy imię jego społecznie.
Sentences_to: I sought Yahweh, and he answered me, and delivered me from all my fears.
Translated_sentences: Praise the Lord with me, and let us exalt his name socially.

Sentences_from: Doznasz też, iż rozmnożone będzie nasienie twoje, a potomstwo twoje będzie jako ziele ziemi.
Sentences_to: You shall know also that your seed shall be great, Your offspring as the grass of the earth.
Translated_sentences: You will also know that your seed will be multiplied, and your seed will be as the herb of the earth.

Sentences_from: Nadto jabłek granatowych cztery sta do onych dwóch siatek, które dwa rzędy jabłek granatowych były na każdej siatce, aby okrywały one dwie gałki okrągłe, które były na wierzchu słupów.
Sentences_to: and the four hundred pomegranates for the two networks; two rows of pomegranates for each network, to cover the two bowls of the capitals that were on the pillars.
Translated_sentences: In addition, pomegranate apples four hundred to these two nets, which two rows of pomegranate apples were on each grid, so that they covered the two round knobs that were on top of the pillars.

Sentences_from: Cić są synowie Racheli, którzy się urodzili Jakóbowi; wszystkich dusz czternaście.
Sentences_to: These are the sons of Rachel, who were born to Jacob: all the souls were fourteen.
Translated_sentences: There are the sons of Rachel who were born to Jacob; fourteen souls.

Sentences_from: A zgoła Bóg przewrotnie nie czyni, a Wszechmocny nie podwraca sądu.
Sentences_to: Yes surely, God will not do wickedly, neither will the Almighty pervert justice.
Translated_sentences: And God does not perversely do not, and the Almighty does not reverse judgment.

Sentences_from: Także złota pewną wagę na wszystkie naczynia złote, od wszystkiej usługi; srebra także na wszystkie naczynia srebrne pewną wagę, na wszystkie naczynia ku wszelakiej usłudze;
Sentences_to: of gold by weight for the gold, for all vessels of every kind of service; for all the vessels of silver by weight, for all vessels of every kind of service;
Translated_sentences: Also gold a certain weight on all gold vessels, from all services; silver also for all silver vessels of a certain weight, for all vessels for all service;

Sentences_from: Niech mię zważy na wadze sprawiedliwej, a niech Bóg pozna szczerość moję.
Sentences_to: (let me be weighed in an even balance, that God may know my integrity);
Translated_sentences: Let me weigh on the weight of the righteous, and may God know my sincerity.

Sentences_from: A widząc mężowie z Azotu, co się działo, rzekli: Niechaj nie zostawa skrzynia Boga Izraelskiego z nami; albowiem sroga jest ręka jego przeciwko nam, i przeciwko Dagonowi, bogu naszemu.
Sentences_to: When the men of Ashdod saw that it was so, they said, "The ark of the God of Israel shall not stay with us; for his hand is severe on us, and on Dagon our god."
Translated_sentences: And seeing the men of Nitrogen what was happening, they said, Let not the chest of the God of Israel remain with us; for his hand is severe against us, and against Dagon our god.

Sentences_from: A gdy Mojżesz wchodził do namiotu zgromadzenia, by się rozmawiał z Bogiem, tedy słyszał głos mówiącego do siebie z ubłagalni, która była nad skrzynią świadectwa, między dwiema Cheruby, a stamtąd mawiał do niego.
Sentences_to: When Moses went into the Tent of Meeting to speak with Yahweh, he heard his voice speaking to him from above the mercy seat that was on the ark of the Testimony, from between the two cherubim: and he spoke to him.
Translated_sentences: And when Moses entered the tent of the assembly to speak with God, he heard the voice speaking to himself from the mercy seat that was above the chest of testimony between the two Cherubs, and from there he spoke to him.

Sentences_from: Sędzie i urzędniki postanowisz sobie we wszystkich bramach twoich, które Pan, Bóg twój, da tobie w każdem pokoleniu twojem, aby sądzili lud sądem sprawiedliwym.
Sentences_to: It shall not seem hard to you, when you let him go free from you; for to the double of the hire of a hireling has he served you six years: and Yahweh your God will bless you in all that you do.
Translated_sentences: Judge and official, you will decide for yourself at all your gates, which the Lord your God will give you in every generation of yours, that they may judge the people with a just judgment.

Sentences_from: Radował się Egipt, gdy oni wychodzili; albowiem był przypadł na nich strach ich.
Sentences_to: Egypt was glad when they departed, for the fear of them had fallen on them.
Translated_sentences: Egypt rejoiced as they went out; for they were afraid of them.

Sentences_from: Dzwonek a jabłko granatowe, i zaś dzwonek i jabłko granatowe, u podołka płaszcza w około ku posługiwaniu, jako rozkazał Pan Mojżeszowi.
Sentences_to: a bell and a pomegranate, a bell and a pomegranate, around the skirts of the robe, to minister in, as Yahweh commanded Moses.
Translated_sentences: A bell and a pomegranate apple, and a bell and a pomegranate apple, at the bottom of the cloak in about the ministry, as the Lord commanded Moses.

Sentences_from: Oto przyjdą dni, w które zabiorą wszystko do Babilonu, cokolwiek jest w domu twoim, i cokolwiek schowali ojcowie twoi aż do dnia tego; nie zostanie ci nic, mówi Pan.
Sentences_to: Truly, Yahweh, the kings of Assyria have laid waste the nations and their lands,
Translated_sentences: Behold, the days will come when they will take all things to Babylon, whatever is in your house, and whatever your fathers have hidden until that day; you will have nothing left, saith the Lord.

Sentences_from: Gdyby człowiek zgrzeszył przeciwko bliźniemu swemu, a przywiódłby go do przysięgi, tak żeby przysięgać musiał, a przyszłaby przysięga ona przed ołtarz twój w tym domu:
Sentences_to: "If a man sin against his neighbor, and an oath is laid on him to cause him to swear, and he comes and swears before your altar in this house;
Translated_sentences: If a man should sin against his neighbor, and bring him to the oath, so that he must swear, and it would come before your altar in this house:

Sentences_from: Oliwę do świecenia, wonne rzeczy na olejek pomazywania, i na wonne kadzenie;
Sentences_to: oil for the light, spices for the anointing oil and for the sweet incense,
Translated_sentences: Oil for shining, fragrant things for the oil of anointing, and for fragrant incense;

Sentences_from: I wrócił ono srebro matce swojej. Tedy wziąwszy matka jego dwieście srebrników, dała je złotnikowi; i uczynił z nich obraz ryty i lany, który był w domu Michasowym.
Sentences_to: When he restored the money to his mother, his mother took two hundred pieces of silver, and gave them to the founder, who made of it an engraved image and a molten image: and it was in the house of Micah.
Translated_sentences: And it returned the silver to his mother. Therefore, taking his mother two hundred pieces of silver, she gave them to the goldsmith; and made of them a picture of engraving and lana, which was in the house of Michas.

Sentences_from: Rzekł zaś Pan do Mojżesza, mówiąc:
Sentences_to: who brought you out of the land of Egypt, to be your God. I am Yahweh."
Translated_sentences: And the Lord said to Moses, saying:

Sentences_from: A to dla wszelkiej złości synów Izraelskich i synów Judzkich, którą popełniali, pobudzając mię do gniewu, sami, królowie ich, książęta ich, kapłani ich i prorocy ich, jako mężowie Judzcy, tak obywatele Jeruzalemscy.
Sentences_to: because of all the evil of the children of Israel and of the children of Judah, which they have done to provoke me to anger, they, their kings, their princes, their priests, and their prophets, and the men of Judah, and the inhabitants of Jerusalem.
Translated_sentences: And this is for all the anger of the sons of Israel and the sons of Judah, which they committed by making me angry, themselves, their kings, their princes, their priests, and their prophets, as men of Judah, so the citizens of Jerusalem.

Sentences_from: I wyciągnął miecz z dołu szumiącego i z błota lgnącego, a postawił na skale nogi moje, i utwierdził kroki moje;
Sentences_to: He has put a new song in my mouth, even praise to our God. Many shall see it, and fear, and shall trust in Yahweh.
Translated_sentences: And he drew a sword from the humming pit and from the clinging mud, and he put my feet on the rock, and confirmed my steps;

Sentences_from: Tedy synowie Ammonowi wyciągnęli, a uszykowali się do bitwy przed samem wejściem w bramę; Syryjczyk zasię z Soby, i Rechob, i Istob, i Maacha byli osobno w polu.
Sentences_to: The children of Ammon came out, and put the battle in array at the entrance of the gate: and the Syrians of Zobah and of Rehob, and the men of Tob and Maacah, were by themselves in the field.
Translated_sentences: Then the sons of Ammon pulled out, and prepared for battle before entering the gate; The Syrian of Soba, and Rechob, and Istob, and Maacha were separately in the field.

Sentences_from: Nad całopalenie poranne, które ma być całopalenie ustawiczne, ofiarować to będziecie,
Sentences_to: You shall offer these besides the burnt offering of the morning, which is for a continual burnt offering.
Translated_sentences: Over the morning burnt offering, which is to be a continuous burnt offering, you will offer it,

Sentences_from: A w dzień ofiary Pańskiej nawiedzę książąt i synów królewskich, i wszystkich, którzy się obłóczą w szaty cudzoziemskie.
Sentences_to: It will happen in the day of Yahweh's sacrifice, that I will punish the princes, the king's sons, and all those who are clothed with foreign clothing.
Translated_sentences: And on the day of the Lord's sacrifice I will see the princes and sons of kings, and all who clothe themselves in foreign garments.

Sentences_from: Tedy przyszedł Adonijasz, syn Haggity, do Betsaby, matki Salomonowej, któremu ona rzekła: A spokojneż jest przyjście twoje? A on odpowiedział: Spokojne.
Sentences_to: Then Adonijah the son of Haggith came to Bathsheba the mother of Solomon. She said, "Do you come peaceably?" He said, "Peaceably.
Translated_sentences: Then came Adoniyah, the son of Haggita, to Bethsaba, Solomon's mother, to whom she said, And thy coming is at peace? And he said, "Calm."

Sentences_from: A tak teraz ja Nabuchodonozor chwalę, i wywyższam i wysławiam króla niebieskiego, którego wszystkie sprawy są prawdą, a ścieszki jego sądem, a który chodzących w hardości poniżyć może.
Sentences_to: At the end of the days I, Nebuchadnezzar, lifted up my eyes to heaven, and my understanding returned to me, and I blessed the Most High, and I praised and honored him who lives forever; for his dominion is an everlasting dominion, and his kingdom from generation to generation.
Translated_sentences: And so now I praise Nebuchadnezzar, and I exalt and praise the king of heaven, whose affairs are all things true, and whose sorrows are his judgment, and who can humiliate the walkers in hardness.

Sentences_from: Te familije Gersonowe za przybytkiem kłać się będą ku zachodowi.
Sentences_to: The families of the Gershonites shall encamp behind the tabernacle westward.
Translated_sentences: These Gerson families behind the tabernacle will bow to the west.

Sentences_from: Pan go będzie strzegł, i żywić go będzie; błogosławony będzie na ziemi, ani go poda na wolę nieprzyjaciół jego.
Sentences_to: Yahweh will sustain him on his sickbed, and restore him from his bed of illness.
Translated_sentences: The Lord will guard him, and he will feed him; he will be blessed on earth, nor will he give it to the will of his enemies.

Sentences_from: Dla domu Pana, Boga naszego, będę szukał twego dobrego.
Sentences_to: For the sake of the house of Yahweh our God, I will seek your good.
Translated_sentences: For the house of the Lord our God, I will seek your good.

Sentences_from: I nie będą się błąkać oczy widzących, i uszy słuchających pilnie słuchać będą.
Sentences_to: The eyes of those who see will not be dim, and the ears of those who hear will listen.
Translated_sentences: And the eyes of the seers will not wander, and the ears of the hearers will listen diligently.

Sentences_from: A Jerycho było zamknione, i opatrzone przed synami Izraelskimi, i nikt z niego nie wychodził, ani do niego wchodził.
Sentences_to: Now Jericho was tightly shut up because of the children of Israel. No one went out, and no one came in.
Translated_sentences: And Jerycho was locked up, and dressed before the sons of Israel, and no one came out of it or entered it.

Sentences_from: Ale gdy będzie lud onej ziemi wchodził przed obliczność Pańską na święta uroczyste, tedy ten, co wnijdzie drogą bramy od północy, aby się kłaniał, wynijdzie drogą bramy południowej; a kto wnijdzie drogą bramy południowej, wynijdzie drogą bramy pół nocnej; nie wróci się drogą onej bramy, którą wszedł, ale przeciwko niej wynijdzie.
Sentences_to: But when the people of the land shall come before Yahweh in the appointed feasts, he who enters by the way of the north gate to worship shall go forth by the way of the south gate; and he who enters by the way of the south gate shall go forth by the way of the north gate: he shall not return by the way of the gate by which he came in, but shall go forth straight before him.
Translated_sentences: But when the people of the earth enter before the presence of the Lord for the solemn feasts, then he who enters by the way of the gate from the north, to bow down, will come out by the way of the southern gate; and whoever enter by the way of the south gate will come out by the way of the half-night gate; one will not return by the way of the gate which he entered, but shall come out against it.

Sentences_from: I odszedł Bóg od niego z miejsca, na którem mówił z nim.
Sentences_to: God went up from him in the place where he spoke with him.
Translated_sentences: And God departed from him from the place where he spoke with him.

Sentences_from: A gdy umarł Hesron w Kaleb Efrata, tedy żona Hesronowa Abija porodziła mu Assura, ojca Tekui.
Sentences_to: After that Hezron was dead in Caleb Ephrathah, then Abijah Hezron's wife bore him Ashhur the father of Tekoa.
Translated_sentences: And when Hesron died in Caleb Efrata, Hesron's wife Abija gave birth to him Assura, the father of Tekua.

Sentences_from: A siedem kapłanów wziąwszy siedem trąb z rogów baranich, przed skrzynią Pańską szli, idąc i trąbiąc w trąby; a zbrojni szli przed nimi, ostatek też ludu pospolitego szedł za skrzynią Pańską, gdy idąc trąbiono w trąby.
Sentences_to: The seven priests bearing the seven trumpets of rams' horns before the ark of Yahweh went on continually, and blew the trumpets: and the armed men went before them. The rear guard came after the ark of Yahweh. The trumpets sounded as they went.
Translated_sentences: And the seven priests, taking seven trumpets from the horns of the rams, went before the Chest of the Lord, walking and honking their trumpets; and the armed went before them, and the remnant of the common people followed the Lord's chest as they went honking their trumpets.

Sentences_from: Tedy rzekł Pan Bóg do węża: Iżeś to uczynił, przeklętym będziesz nad wszystkie zwierzęta, i nad wszystkie bestyje polne; na brzuchu twoim czołgać się będziesz, a proch żreć będziesz po wszystkie dni żywota twego.
Sentences_to: Yahweh God said to the serpent, "Because you have done this, you are cursed above all livestock, and above every animal of the field. On your belly you shall go, and you shall eat dust all the days of your life.
Translated_sentences: Then the Lord God said to the serpent, Thou shy thou hast done this, thou sh should be cursed over all animals, and over all beasts of the field; on your stomach you shall crawl, and dust shall be chorned for all the days of your life.

Sentences_from: Ale Heli zstarzał się był bardzo, i słyszał wszystko, co czynili synowie jego całemu Izraelowi, i jako sypiali z niewiastami, które się schadzały przede drzwi namiotu zgromadzenia.
Sentences_to: Now Eli was very old; and he heard all that his sons did to all Israel, and how that they lay with the women who served at the door of the Tent of Meeting.
Translated_sentences: But Eli grew very old, and he heard all that his sons had done to all Israel, and as they slept with the women who were walking down before the door of the tent of the assembly.

Sentences_from: I oddane jest pole i jaskinia, która była na niem, Abrahamowi w osiadłość grobu, od synów Hetowych.
Sentences_to: The field, and the cave that is in it, were deeded to Abraham for a possession of a burying place by the children of Heth.
Translated_sentences: And the field and the cave that was on it are given to Abraham in the settlement of the tomb, from the sons of the Hitt.

Sentences_from: A była granica Amorejczykowa od góry, gdzie wstępują do niedźwiadków, od skały ich i wyżej.
Sentences_to: The border of the Amorites was from the ascent of Akrabbim, from the rock, and upward.
Translated_sentences: And there was the Amorean border from the top, where they ascend to the bears, from the rock of them and above.

Sentences_from: Aby więcej nie błądził dom Izraelski odemnie, a nie mazali się więcej żadnemi przestępstwami swojemi, aby byli ludem moim, a Ja abym był Bogiem ich, mówi panujący Pan.
Sentences_to: that the house of Israel may go no more astray from me, neither defile themselves any more with all their transgressions; but that they may be my people, and I may be their God, says the Lord Yahweh.
Translated_sentences: That the house of Israel may no longer err from me, and that they may no longer be subject to any of their crimes, that they may be my people, and that I may be their God, saith the reigning Lord.

Sentences_from: A tak zgromadzili się do Masfa, a czerpając wodę, wylewali przed Panem, i pościli tam dnia onego, mówiąc: Zgrzeszyliśmy Panu. I sądził Samuel syny Izraelskie w Masfa.
Sentences_to: They gathered together to Mizpah, and drew water, and poured it out before Yahweh, and fasted on that day, and said there, "We have sinned against Yahweh." Samuel judged the children of Israel in Mizpah.
Translated_sentences: And so they gathered to Masfa, and drawing water, they poured out before the Lord, and fasted there on that day, saying, We have sinned to the Lord. And Samuel judged the sons of Israel in Masfa.

Sentences_from: Rozgniewałem się był na lud mój, splugawiłem dziedzictwo moje, a dałem je w ręce twoje; aleś im ty nie okazała miłosierdzia, i starców obciążałaś jarzmem twojem bardzo,
Sentences_to: I was angry with my people, I profaned my inheritance, and gave them into your hand: you showed them no mercy; on the aged you have very heavily laid your yoke.
Translated_sentences: I was angry with my people, I defiled my inheritance, and I gave it into your hands; but thou hast not shown mercy to them, and thou hast burdened the elderly with yoke very much,

Sentences_from: Dnia onego będzie Izrael jako trzeci między Egipczanem i Assyryjczykiem, a błogosławieństwo będzie w pośrodku ziemi.
Sentences_to: In that day, Israel will be the third with Egypt and with Assyria, a blessing in the midst of the earth;
Translated_sentences: On that day Israel will be the third between the Egyptian and the Assyrian, and the blessing will be in the middle of the earth.

Sentences_from: A syn Hananijaszowy: Faltyjasz, i Jesajasz; synowie Rafajaszowi, synowie Arnanaszowi, synowie Obadyjaszowi, synowie Sechenijaszowi.
Sentences_to: The sons of Hananiah: Pelatiah, and Jeshaiah; the sons of Rephaiah, the sons of Arnan, the sons of Obadiah, the sons of Shecaniah.
Translated_sentences: And Hananiyah's son, Faltyyash, and Yeseaiah; sons of Rafaiah, sons of Arnanas, sons of Obadyyas, sons of Secheniah.

Sentences_from: Jeźli do miłościwego lata poświęcił rolę swoję, według szacunku twego zostanie.
Sentences_to: If he dedicates his field from the Year of Jubilee, according to your valuation it shall stand.
Translated_sentences: If he devoted his role to a loving summer, it is your estimate that he will remain.

Sentences_from: I dał Pan Mojżeszowi dokonawszy mowy z nim na górze Synaj dwie tablice świadectwa, tablice kamienne, pisane palcem Bożym.
Sentences_to: He gave to Moses, when he finished speaking with him on Mount Sinai, the two tablets of the testimony, stone tablets, written with God's finger.
Translated_sentences: And the Lord gave Moses, having spoken with him on Mount Sinai, two tablets of testimony, tablets of stone, written with the finger of God.

Sentences_from: Abym poświęcił wielkie imię moje, które było splugawione między narodami, któreście wy zmazali w pośrodku ich; i dowiedzą się narody, żem Ja Pan, mówi panujący Pan, gdy poświęcony będę w was przed oczyma ich;
Sentences_to: I will sanctify my great name, which has been profaned among the nations, which you have profaned in their midst; and the nations shall know that I am Yahweh, says the Lord Yahweh, when I shall be sanctified in you before their eyes.
Translated_sentences: That I may consecrate my great name, which was defiled among the nations, which you have blotted out in the midst of them; and the nations will know that I am the Lord, saith the reigning Lord, when I am consecrated in you before their eyes;

Sentences_from: Ale jeźliżby po miłościwem lecie poświęcił rolę twoję tedy kapłan obrachuje mu pieniądze według lat zostawających do miłościwego lata i umniejszy mu się z szacunku twego.
Sentences_to: "'If you in spite of these things will not listen to me, then I will chastise you seven times more for your sins.
Translated_sentences: But if, after the love of the summer, he devotes his role to yours, then the priest robs him of the money according to the years remaining until the loving summer, and diminishs him out of your respect.
